variant.name: NavigationPrefetch
variant.summary: Recorded for prefetches where Chrome is relatively confident an omnibox navigation is about to occur (i.e. the user selected a search suggestion). These prefetches allow Chrome to kickstart the request without waiting until before unload handlers or other navigation pre-processing mechanisms in Chrome.

variant.name: SuggestionPrefetch
variant.summary: Recorded for prefetches where an omnibox suggestion from the suggestion server recommends a prefetch of a suggestion results page.

variant.name: NavigationPrefetch
variant.summary: Recorded for prefetches where Chrome is relatively confident an omnibox navigation is about to occur (i.e. the user selected a search suggestion). These prefetches allow Chrome to kickstart the request without waiting until before unload handlers or other navigation pre-processing mechanisms in Chrome.

variant.name: SearchPrefetch
variant.summary: Search Prefetch issues results page requests in response to either the suggestion server or the Omnibox client being confident that the user will navigate to a specific search suggestion. These requests are then served instantly to the user when the user navigates to a search suggestion with the same search terms. These requests can have mismatching query params as the Omnibox client updates the search navigation URL as the user types more into the Omnibox. The suggestion server issues prefetch hints along with the suggestion request. Additionally, the Omnibox client decides to prefetch when the user has chosen (or likely chosen) a search suggestion to initiate the search suggestion navigation earlier.

variant.name: PriceAlertsMessageCard
variant.summary: the promo message for price notifications

variant.name: OpenFile
variant.summary: call to openFile() that returns results as a FileDescriptor

variant.name: Query
variant.summary: call to query() that returns results in a Cursor

variant.name: AppWidget
variant.summary: tabs opened from an app widget

variant.name: BookmarkBarBackground
variant.summary: tabs opened from the bookmark bar which are opened in the background

variant.name: BrowserActions
variant.summary: tabs opened from browser actions context menu

variant.name: CollaborationBackgroundInGroup
variant.summary: tabs opened from collaboration protection mechanism

variant.name: ExternalApp
variant.summary: tabs opened from an external app

variant.name: HistoryNavigationBackground
variant.summary: tabs opened in background from back/forward history navigation

variant.name: HistoryNavigationForeground
variant.summary: tabs opened in foreground from back/forward history navigation

variant.name: LinkCreatingNewWindow
variant.summary: tabs opened from a link, creating a new window

variant.name: LongpressBackground
variant.summary: tabs opened from the long press context menu which are opened in the background

variant.name: LongpressBackgroundInGroup
variant.summary: tabs opened from long press context menu item 'Open in new tab in group'

variant.name: LongpressForeground
variant.summary: tabs opened from the long press context menu

variant.name: LongpressForegroundInGroup
variant.summary: For tabs which must be opened in the foreground in the same group as the parent

variant.name: LongpressIncognito
variant.summary: tabs opened from the long press context menu item 'Open in Incognito Tab'

variant.name: NewIncognitoTab
variant.summary: tabs opened by an external application launching a new Chrome incognito tab

variant.name: ReadingList
variant.summary: tabs opened from the reading list

variant.name: RecentTabs
variant.summary: tabs opened in background from recent tabs

variant.name: RecentTabsForeground
variant.summary: tabs opened in foreground from recent tabs

variant.name: Reparenting
variant.summary: tabs opened in foreground from changing windows

variant.name: ReparentingBackground
variant.summary: tabs opened in background from changing windows

variant.name: RestoreTabsUI
variant.summary: tabs opened from restore tabs UI

variant.name: SpeculativeBackgroundCreation
variant.summary: tabs opened from CCT in the background

variant.name: StartSurface
variant.summary: tabs opened from the start surface

variant.name: Startup
variant.summary: tabs opened during the startup process

variant.name: SyncBackground
variant.summary: tabs opened in the background by sync

variant.name: TabGroupUI
variant.summary: tabs opened from Tab group UI

variant.name: TabListInterface
variant.summary: tabs opened from tab list interface

variant.name: TabSwitcherUI
variant.summary: tabs opened from Tab Switcher UI

variant.name: TypeUnknown
variant.summary: tabs opened from a different case than one's listed

variant.name: .AsyncButFullySync
variant.summary: Startup was triggered on a background thread, the posted task was not run yet. Then another init call on the UI thread was started before the posted task and startup fully completed synchronously

variant.name: .FullyAsync
variant.summary: Startup was triggered on a background thread and completed asynchronously

variant.name: .FullySync
variant.summary: Startup was triggered on the UI thread and completed synchronously

variant.name: .PartialAsyncThenSync
variant.summary: Startup was triggered on a background thread, some tasks ran asynchronously. Then another init call on the UI thread preempted the async run and startup completed synchronously

variant.name: .Unknown
variant.summary: Something went wrong in our metrics. (The histogram may need to be re-reviewed.)

histogram.name: Android.ActivityStop.NumberOfPinnedTabsUsed
histogram.summary: Captures the number of regular and incognito pinned tabs used. Pinned tabs used are calculated by identifying the number of pinned tabs that were selected between ChromeTabbedActivity onResumeWithNative() and onStopWithNative(). This is recorded when onStopWithNative() is called.

histogram.name: Android.ActivityStop.NumberOfTabsUsed
histogram.summary: Captures the number of regular and incognito tabs used. Used tabs are calculated by identifying the number of tabs that were selected between ChromeTabbedActivity onResumeWithNative() and onStopWithNative(). This is recorded when onStopWithNative() is called by backgrounding the app or by opening another activity like SettingsActivity. If multiple instances are running, each instance will only track and record usage of tabs that it contains.

histogram.name: Android.ActivityStop.PercentageOfPinnedTabsUsed
histogram.summary: Captures the percentage of regular and incognito pinned tabs used. This is calculated by finding the ratio of the number of pinned tabs used to the total number of pinned tabs available between ChromeTabbedActivity onResumedWithNative and onStopWithNative. Total number of pinned tabs available is the sum of the pinned tab count when CTA is resumed and any new tabs that are pinned before CTA is stopped. This is recorded when ChromeTabbedActivity#onStopWithNative() is called.

histogram.name: Android.ActivityStop.PercentageOfTabsUsed
histogram.summary: Captures the percentage of regular and incognito tabs used. This is calculated by finding the ratio of the number of tabs used to the total number of tabs available between ChromeTabbedActivity onResumedWithNative and onStopWithNative. Total number of tabs available is the sum of the tab count when CTA is resumed and any new tabs that are opened before CTA is stopped. This is recorded when ChromeTabbedActivity#onStopWithNative() is called by backgrounding the app or by opening another activity like SettingsActivity. If multiple instances are running, each instance will only track and record usage of tabs that it contains.

histogram.name: Android.AdaptiveToolbarButton.Clicked
histogram.summary: Reports the variant of the optional toolbar button that was clicked.

histogram.name: Android.AdaptiveToolbarButton.SessionVariant
histogram.summary: Reports the variant of the optional toolbar button used during the session. The button is placed in the toolbar, and is clickable.

histogram.name: Android.AdaptiveToolbarButton.Settings.Changed
histogram.summary: Records the newly selected radio button option for the adaptive toolbar button on the toolbar shortcut settings page. Recorded only when the selected radio button state is changed.

histogram.name: Android.AdaptiveToolbarButton.Settings.Startup
histogram.summary: Records the currently selected radio button option for the adaptive toolbar button on the toolbar shortcut settings page. Recorded on startup, only if AdaptiveButtonInTopToolbarCustomization feature is enabled.

histogram.name: Android.AdaptiveToolbarButton.SettingsToggle.Changed
histogram.summary: Records whether the toolbar settings toggle button is on or off on the toolbar shortcut settings page after the user manually changes it. Recorded after the user explicitly taps on the toggle button.

histogram.name: Android.AdaptiveToolbarButton.SettingsToggle.Startup
histogram.summary: Records whether the toolbar settings toggle button is on or off on the toolbar shortcut settings page. Recorded on startup.

histogram.name: Android.AdaptiveToolbarButton.Variant.OnPageLoad
histogram.summary: Reports the variant of the optional toolbar button that was shown after a page load. Reports only when a page is loaded or a tab is switched. Reports only when the contextual page actions feature is enabled and after all the action providers have responded or the request has timed out. Only reported for pages in the regular profile.

histogram.name: Android.AdaptiveToolbarButton.Variant.OnStartNavigation
histogram.summary: Reports the variant of the optional toolbar button being shown during the start of a new navigation. Reports whenever TabObserver.onDidStartNavigationInPrimaryMainFrame() is called which then records the button variant currently being shown on the toolbar. Recorded for both regular and incognito profiles.

histogram.name: Android.ApplicationState.TimeInBackgroundBeforeForegroundedAgain
histogram.summary: Record the time the application spent in the background in-between two foregrounded periods, meaning that when the application is started in background, then foregrounded, no data points are recorded. This is recorded at the end of each such background interval. Saturates at 1h.

histogram.name: Android.AppNotificationStatus
histogram.summary: Records whether notifications are enabled for Chrome, as the Android app, every time metrics are logged.

histogram.name: Android.ArmCpuPart
histogram.summary: Reports information about the ARM CPU of a device. This composes the 8-bit ARM implementer identifier and the 12-bit part number into a single 20-bit CPU identifier, ranging from [0x00000,0xFFFFF]. Depending on the CPU package, processor configuration, and/or kernel version, this may only report information about the processor on which the metric was collected. This can happen on heterogeneous-processor SoCs. The metric is logged once every startup.

histogram.name: Android.AssistContent.AttachedUrl
histogram.summary: Records whether the current web page URI was attached to an AssistContent object when assistant was invoked while ChromeActivity was in the foreground.

histogram.name: Android.AssistContent.IsEnterpriseInfoCached
histogram.summary:
Records whether enterprise info was cached while trying to populate an AssistContent when assistant was invoked while ChromeActivity was in the foreground.
If false we don't populate AssistContent.
Only recorded when the "PageContentProvider" feature is enabled and assistant is invoked while viewing a web page.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2025-06-01 to 2025-11-25; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Android.AssistContent.StructuredDataAttachedSuccess.Pdf
histogram.summary:
Records whether PDF structured data was successfully attached to an AssistContent object when assistant was invoked while ChromeActivity was in the foreground.
Only recorded when the "AndroidPdfAssistContent" feature is enabled and assistant is invoked while viewing a PDF.

histogram.name: Android.AssistContent.StructuredDataAttachedSuccess.WebPage
histogram.summary:
Records whether web page structured data was successfully attached to an AssistContent object when assistant was invoked while ChromeActivity was in the foreground.
Only recorded when the "PageContentProvider" feature is enabled and assistant is invoked while viewing a web page.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2025-06-01 to 2025-11-25; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Android.AssistContent.WebPage
histogram.summary:
Records whether a JSON string with ContentProvider URIs was attached to an AssistContent object when assistant was invoked while ChromeActivity was in the foreground.
Recorded when an assistant is invoked while viewing a non-incognito http/s web page.

histogram.name: Android.AssistContent.WebPageContentProvider.Events
histogram.summary: Records events related to WebPageContentProvider as it generates a URI for an external app and as it handles queries from said external app.

histogram.name: Android.AssistContent.WebPageContentProvider.Events.{RequestType}.{Format}
histogram.summary:
Records events related to WebPageContentProvider as it generates a URI for an external app and as it handles queries from said external app.
Recorded when an external app requests {Format} with a {RequestType}.

histogram.name: Android.AssistContent.WebPageContentProvider.GetAssistantPackageResult
histogram.summary:
Records whether we were able to get the package name of the default assistant app from Android's settings. Recorded when AssistContent is requested for web pages.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2025-09-07 to 2025-11-25; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Android.AssistContent.WebPageContentProvider.Latency.CreateToExtractionStart.{RequestType}.{Format}
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time passed between sending a web page content provider URI to an external app and receiving a query from an external app with the same URI (this starts a content extraction task).

histogram.name: Android.AssistContent.WebPageContentProvider.Latency.ExtractionStartToEnd.{RequestType}.{Format}
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time passed while extracting a web page's contents.

histogram.name: Android.AssistContent.WebPageContentProvider.Latency.TotalLatency.{RequestType}.{Format}
histogram.summary: Records the total amount of time passed between sending a web page content provider URI to an external app and it receiving the web page's contents.

histogram.name: Android.Automotive.DeviceLockDialogAction.{Source}
histogram.summary: Records action user took when presented with the device lock explainer dialog (ex: button clicked) during a {Source} flow. Other actions such as clicking back on the automotive toolbar or clicking outside of the dialog to escape it can be calculated by subtracting button clicks from number of times the dialog was shown.

histogram.name: Android.Automotive.DeviceLockOutcome
histogram.summary: Records whether the user successfully passed the device lock challenge after having seen the automotive device lock explainer dialog.

histogram.name: Android.Automotive.DeviceLockRemovalDialogEvent
histogram.summary: Records an event whenever the missing device lock dialog is shown to the user or the user takes an action on the dialog.

histogram.name: Android.Automotive.DeviceLockSet
histogram.summary: Records whether the automotive device has a device lock set when Chrome is resumed.

histogram.name: Android.Automotive.UiScalingFactor
histogram.summary: Records the scaling factor applied to the UI on an automotive device. This value is recorded once per activity start as a percentage, with 134% being the default scale-up.

histogram.name: Android.BackgroundRestrictions.IsBackgroundRestricted
histogram.summary: Records whether user has enabled background restriction for chrome. Recorded after native initialization in browser process.

histogram.name: Android.BackgroundRestrictions.StandbyBucket
histogram.summary: Records the standby bucket (UsageStatsManager.getAppStandbyBucket) in which chrome is currently placed by android. Recorded after native initialization in browser process.

histogram.name: Android.BackgroundRestrictions.StandbyBucket.WithUserRestriction
histogram.summary: Records the standby bucket (UsageStatsManager.getAppStandbyBucket) in which chrome is currently placed by android, when user has explicitly enabled background restrictions. Recorded after native initialization in browser process.

histogram.name: Android.BackgroundTaskScheduler.ExactTaskCreated
histogram.summary:
Records that an exact task has been created. Cached when the task is scheduled.
Cached to SharedPreferences to be recorded in the next ChromeActivity start instead of recorded immediately on background.

histogram.name: Android.BackgroundTaskScheduler.SetNotification.{TaskType}
histogram.summary: Measures the time starting from the instant the task was started till a notification was set on the background task job service for a task of type {TaskType}. Recorded when the notification was set as long as the task isn't finished.

histogram.name: Android.BackgroundTaskScheduler.TaskCanceled
histogram.summary:
Records that a specific background task has been canceled.
Cached to SharedPreferences to be recorded in the next ChromeActivity start instead of recorded immediately on background.

histogram.name: Android.BackgroundTaskScheduler.TaskCreated.WithExpiration
histogram.summary:
Records that a specific task has been created with an expiration deadline. Cached when the task is scheduled.
Cached to SharedPreferences to be recorded in the next ChromeActivity start instead of recorded immediately on background.

histogram.name: Android.BackgroundTaskScheduler.TaskCreated.WithoutExpiration
histogram.summary:
Records that a specific task has been created without the expiration feature activated. Cached when the task is scheduled.
Cached to SharedPreferences to be recorded in the next ChromeActivity start instead of recorded immediately on background.

histogram.name: Android.BackgroundTaskScheduler.TaskExpired
histogram.summary:
Records that a specific background task has expired. Cached before the task is to be started.
Cached to SharedPreferences to be recorded in the next ChromeActivity start instead of recorded immediately on background.

histogram.name: Android.BackgroundTaskScheduler.TaskFinished.{TaskType}
histogram.summary:
Records the time (uptimeMillis) taken by a background task of type {TaskType}. Recorded when the task finished callback is invoked.
Differs from other Android.BackgroundTaskScheduler histograms in that it is recorded immediately in background, instead of in the next time Chrome is run in foreground, so cannot be directly compared.

histogram.name: Android.BackgroundTaskScheduler.TaskFinished2
histogram.summary:
Records that a specific background task has finished.
Cached to SharedPreferences to be recorded in the next ChromeActivity start instead of recorded immediately on background.
Differs from "TaskFinished" in that it is recorded in the same session as "TaskStarted", making them comparable for success rate calculations and ensuring they are in the same experiment group (which is not the case for "TaskFinished").

histogram.name: Android.BackgroundTaskScheduler.TaskLoadedNative
histogram.summary:
Records that a task extending a NativeBackgroundTask started loading the native portion of Chrome.
Cached to SharedPreferences to be recorded in the next ChromeActivity start instead of recorded immediately on background.

histogram.name: Android.BackgroundTaskScheduler.TaskScheduled.Failure
histogram.summary:
Records that a specific background task has failed to be scheduled.
Cached to SharedPreferences to be recorded in the next ChromeActivity start instead of recorded immediately on background.

histogram.name: Android.BackgroundTaskScheduler.TaskScheduled.Success
histogram.summary:
Records that a specific background task has been successfully scheduled.
Cached to SharedPreferences to be recorded in the next ChromeActivity start instead of recorded immediately on background.

histogram.name: Android.BackgroundTaskScheduler.TaskStarted
histogram.summary:
Records that a specific background task has been started.
Cached to SharedPreferences to be recorded in the next ChromeActivity start instead of recorded immediately on background.

histogram.name: Android.BackgroundTaskScheduler.TaskStopped
histogram.summary:
Records that a specific background task has been stopped by Background Task Scheduler before it was able to complete itself.
Cached to SharedPreferences to be recorded in the next ChromeActivity start instead of recorded immediately on background.

histogram.name: Android.BackPress.Backfalsing2
histogram.summary: Recorded when a user navigates to a URL by a navigation gesture or a navigation button and then a backfalsing event happens. Recorded for both swipes and clicks in both 3-button mode and gesture navigation mode.

histogram.name: Android.BackPress.Failure
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user invokes a back navigation only if the handler failed to operate as expected, (e.g. it does nothing). May be recorded multiple times for a single back press event if there are multiple failed handlers. Android only.

histogram.name: Android.BackPress.IncorrectEdgeSwipe
histogram.summary: Records any incorrect edge swipes the user tries to perform. Recorded in 3-button mode when the user tries to swipe from the forward edge and the page is not navigable, such as when the forward stack is empty. Android only.

histogram.name: Android.BackPress.IncorrectEdgeSwipe.CountChained
histogram.summary: Records the consecutive number of incorrect edge swipes the user tries to perform if the number of incorrect edge swipes are greater than zero. Recorded in 3-button mode when the user makes a correct edge swipe, which is when the user swipes from either the right edge or the left edge and the page is navigable. Android only.

histogram.name: Android.BackPress.Intercept.CustomTab.{Task}
histogram.summary: Recorded when a custom tabs feature intercepted the system's back press gesture {Task}.

variant.name: SameTask
variant.summary: custom tab is from the same task.

variant.name: SeparateTask
variant.summary: custom tab is from a separate task.

histogram.name: Android.BackPress.Intercept{Direction}
histogram.summary: Recorded when a specific feature intercepted the system's back press gesture{Direction}.

histogram.name: Android.BackPress.MinimizeAppAndCloseTab
histogram.summary: Records that the back press causes the app to be minimized or the current tab to be closed.

histogram.name: Android.BackPress.MinimizeAppAndCloseTab.CustomTab.{Task}
histogram.summary: Records that the custom tabs back press causes the app to be minimized or the current tab to be closed {Task}.

variant.name: SameTask
variant.summary: custom tab is from the same task.

variant.name: SeparateTask
variant.summary: custom tab is from a separate task.

histogram.name: Android.BackPress.StrictBackfalsing
histogram.summary: Another version of Android.BackPress.Backfalsing2 with strict definition of "Backfalsing". Recorded when a user navigates to a URL by a navigation gesture or a navigation button and then a backfalsing event happens within **3 seconds**. Recorded for both swipes and clicks in both 3-button mode and gesture navigation mode.

histogram.name: Android.BackPress.SwipeEdge{Type}
histogram.summary: Record the edge from which the gesture is swiped from {Type}.

variant.name: .TabHistoryNavigation
variant.summary: when a back gesture triggers a tab history navigation.

histogram.name: Android.BackPress.TabClosureType
histogram.summary: Record the type of tab closure caused by back press. Record when tab is about to be closed.

histogram.name: Android.BindingManger.ConnectionsDroppedDueToMaxSize
histogram.summary: Records the total number of BindingManager bindings to ChildProcessConnections that were dropped due to the BindingManager reaching the connection limit. This value accumulates while the app is running and is emitted upong the app being backgrounded at which time the counter is reset.

histogram.name: Android.BottomControlsStacker.NumberOfVisibleLayers
histogram.summary: Records the number of visible bottom controls layers. Recorded when a navigation finishes in the main frame of the active tab.

histogram.name: Android.BottomControlsStacker.PercentageOfWindowUsedByBottomControlsAtMaxHeight
histogram.summary: Records the percentage of the window's total height used by the bottom controls stack at full height. This is the maximum % the window is obscured by the bottom controls, which can ordinarily be scrolled off. Recorded when a navigation finishes in the main frame of the active tab.

histogram.name: Android.BottomControlsStacker.PercentageOfWindowUsedByBottomControlsAtMinHeight
histogram.summary: Records the percentage of the window's total height used by the bottom controls stack at its minimum height. This is the minimum % the window is obscured by the bottom controls, which cannot ordinarily be scrolled off. Recorded when a navigation finishes in the main frame of the active tab.

histogram.name: Android.BrowserControls.LockedByTabState
histogram.summary: Records whether browser controls is forced to be visible by the tab state when controls visibility is updated. Recorded at TabStateBrowserControlsVisibilityDelegate.enableHidingBrowserControls().

histogram.name: Android.BrowserControls.LockedByTabState.Reason
histogram.summary: Records the reason when browser controls is forced to be visible. The enums in the histogram can be recorded multiple times. Recorded at TabStateBrowserControlsVisibilityDelegate.enableHidingBrowserControls().

histogram.name: Android.BrowserControls.OutstandingChangedOnFinish
histogram.summary: Records if the outstanding navigations set changed when a navigation is finished. This means the navigation id was not previously tracked, either because it never started or it already finished once. When things are working correctly, this should always be true. There are known tests and likely some real scenarios that currently violate this.

histogram.name: Android.BrowserControls.OutstandingChangedOnStart
histogram.summary: Records if the outstanding navigations set changed when a navigation is started. This means the navigation id was previously tracked and then the same id was claimed to be started again. If things are working correctly, this metric should always be true. No existing violations of this are currently known.

histogram.name: Android.BrowserControls.OutstandingNavigationsOnFinish
histogram.summary: Records the number of outstanding navigations that are blocking the browser controls from being scrollable. Recorded when a navigation completes. Typically the value should be 0 or maybe 1 for a very short amount of time. Large numbers here indicate there's a bug that's keeping the controls visible.

histogram.name: Android.BrowserControls.RenderDrivenShowConstraint
histogram.summary: Records when browser controls constraint is set to "SHOWN", whether the render is capable to drive the browser controls show animation. The record is used for crbug.com/449011189. Recorded after native is fully initialized and when feature BrowserControlsRenderDrivenShowConstraint is enabled.

histogram.name: Android.BrowsingDataModel.ModelDestructionTime
histogram.summary: This histogram records the time taken to destroy the android browsing data model wrapper with its contents. This is recorded each time the model is destroyed on the Java side when the destroy method is called.

histogram.name: Android.ChildProcessBinding.BatchScopeDurationOnMainThread
histogram.summary: Measures the duration of the ScopedServiceBindingBatch batching scope on the main thread. This metric is recorded when the batching scope is closed. This is recorded regardless of whether the service binding batching feature is enabled. ScopedServiceBindingBatch can be nested. This metrics measures the duration of the outermost batching scope.

histogram.name: Android.ChildProcessBinding.BinderIPC.Count
histogram.summary: Records the number of BindService.doBindService() calls. This is emitted every 5 minutes on Chrome on Android while in the foreground.

histogram.name: Android.ChildProcessBinding.BinderIPC.{Type}.Count
histogram.summary: Records the number of {Type} calls. This is emitted every 5 minutes on Chrome on Android while in the foreground.

histogram.name: Android.ChildProcessBinding.SetPriorityLatency
histogram.summary: Records the latency from posting SetRenderProcessPriorityOnLauncherThread on the main thread to its execution complete on the launcher thread. It is recorded when SetRenderProcessPriorityOnLauncherThread is executed. This metrics is recorded on all Android clients.

histogram.name: Android.ChildProcessBinding.TotalBindingCount
histogram.summary: Records the total number of service bindings for sandboxed ChildProcessConnections in existence. This is emitted even if there are no live connections. Emitted at a Poisson distributed period with a mean of 5 minutes on Chrome on Android while in the foreground.

histogram.name: Android.ChildProcessBinding.TotalConnections
histogram.summary: Records the total number of sandboxed ChildProcessConnections in existence. This is emitted even if there are no live connections. Emitted at a Poisson distributed period with a mean of 5 minutes on Chrome on Android while in the foreground.

histogram.name: Android.ChildProcessBinding.{ChildProcessConnectionMetricsBindingState}BindingCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of {ChildProcessConnectionMetricsBindingState} service bindings for sandboxed ChildProcessConnections. This is emitted even if there are no live connections. Emitted at a Poisson distributed period with a mean of 5 minutes on Chrome on Android while in the foreground.

histogram.name: Android.ChildProcessBinding.{ChildProcessConnectionMetricsBindingState}Connections
histogram.summary: Records the number of sandboxed ChildProcessConnections with a {ChildProcessConnectionMetricsBindingState}. This is emitted even if there are no live connections. Emitted at a Poisson distributed period with a mean of 5 minutes on Chrome on Android while in the foreground.

histogram.name: Android.ChildProcessConectionEventCounts
histogram.summary: Record events in ChildProcessConnection. Recorded when the specific events happen. Note individual counts may or may not be independent or mutually exclusive; thus total count is meaningless. Counts can be compared with each other, or need to be normalized with something else (eg number of child process launches).

histogram.name: Android.ChildProcessConnection.OnServiceConnectedCounts
histogram.summary: Record the accumulated count of ChildServiceConnectionDelegate.onServiceConnected. This is recorded every time the callback is triggered. The metric with number more than 1 indicates that the child process is restarted after the service process connected. Note that the lower buckets double-counts the higher buckets since this is recorded at each restart (e.g. when 4 is recorded, 1,2,3 are also recorded).

histogram.name: Android.ChildProcessRanking.{RankType}.Count
histogram.summary: Records the number of child process connections that are classified as {RankType}. Whether the process is high rank or low rank is determined by ChildProcessRanking.shouldBeInLowRankGroup() This is recorded when the application is sent to the background.

histogram.name: Android.ChildProcessStartTimeV2.{Type}
histogram.summary:
Measures time from {Type} child process starts to right before main. Only recorded on Android N+. Zygote measurements are recorded on Q+.
Zygote measurements capture the CPU time (thread time) spent to create the app zygote process, before the zygote preload starts. For other processes it measures the time (uptimeMillis) to create the child process service.

histogram.name: Android.ChromeActivity.Type
histogram.summary:
Recorded at the same time as "CustomTabs.Visible", this metric should eventually replace that one. This additionally distinguishes between Trusted Web Activities, WebAPKs and Webapps.
As of M87, this histogram is logged on a log start, rather than log end to tag more logs.

histogram.name: Android.ChromeStartupDelegate.FailureReason
histogram.summary:
Records the failure reason for ChromeStartupDelegate requests. Recorded at most once on application startup.
(Expired in 2022-12-25. Revived in 2025-01-07.)

histogram.name: Android.ChromeStartupDelegate.Result
histogram.summary:
Records the result for ChromeStartupDelegate. Recorded on application startup.
(Expired in 2022-10-16. Revived in 2025-01-07.)

histogram.name: Android.Compositor.IsRequestingOpaqueSurface
histogram.summary: Records whether CopmositorSurfaceManager.requestSurface a surface with PixelFormat.OPAQUE when the method is called. Used to idicate how often an opaque SurfaceView is used.

histogram.name: Android.Compositor.UpdateLayerTree.Duration.Subsampled
histogram.summary: Records the duration of CompositorView::UpdateLayerTreeHost on Android, which updates the layer tree when a frame is requested. Subsampled to 1/100.

histogram.name: Android.ContactsPicker.ContactCount
histogram.summary: Measures the total number of contacts shown in the contacts picker. Measured once when the Contacts Picker dialog is dismissed.

histogram.name: Android.ContactsPicker.DialogAction
histogram.summary: Records which action the user takes in the ContactsPickerDialog. Measured once when the Contacts Picker dialog is dismissed.

histogram.name: Android.ContactsPicker.PropertiesRequested
histogram.summary: The contact properties requested by the website (names, emails, telephone numbers). Measured once when the Contacts Picker dialog is dismissed. Note: This metric was not logged in June 2023.

histogram.name: Android.ContactsPicker.PropertiesUserRejected
histogram.summary: The contact properties requested by the website but rejected by the user. Measured once when the Contacts Picker dialog is dismissed.

histogram.name: Android.ContactsPicker.SelectCount
histogram.summary: Measures the total number of contacts selected in the contacts picker. Measured once when the Contacts Picker dialog is dismissed. Note: This metric was not logged in June 2023.

histogram.name: Android.ContactsPicker.SelectPercentage
histogram.summary: Measures the percentage of contacts selected in the contacts picker. Measured once when the Contacts Picker dialog is dismissed. Note: This metric was not logged in June 2023.

histogram.name: Android.CpuAbiBitnessSupport
histogram.summary:
Whether 64-bit and/or 32-bit apps can be installed on this device/OS.
This is recorded every time a metrics log is created.

histogram.name: Android.CustomTab.CannotOpenUrlInBrowser.IsPdf
histogram.summary: Records whether the custom tab is a pdf page when it fails to open current url in browser. Used to diagnose and evaluate how often this occurs for prioritization.

histogram.name: Android.DarkTheme.AutoDarkMode.SettingsChangeSource{NewState}
histogram.summary: Source that changed the auto dark web content settings. This includes both changes to global theme settings as well as individual site exceptions. This histogram does not take into account whether the browser UI theme is dark or not (e.g. browser theme could be "light" and user could still change auto dark mode state in site settings). Recorded when the auto dark web content settings changes including {NewState}

variant.name: .Disabled
variant.summary: default value change to Blocked, or a site exception is added.

variant.name: .Enabled
variant.summary: default value change to Allowed, or a site exception is removed.

histogram.name: Android.DarkTheme.EnabledState
histogram.summary: Records whether dark theme is enabled or not on cold start and when the enabled state changes.

histogram.name: Android.DarkTheme.ThemeSettingsEntry
histogram.summary: Entry that navigate the user into the Theme Settings. Recorded when the Theme settings is opened.

histogram.name: Android.DefaultBrowserPromo.Outcome.{CurrentState}
histogram.summary: The final default browser state (outcome) after the user has been prompted to set Chrome as the default when {CurrentState} is set as the default initially. Recorded when the system UI prompting the user to change their default is dismissed.

histogram.name: Android.DefaultBrowserPromo.Outcome.{CurrentState}.{PromoCount}
histogram.summary: The final default browser state (outcome) after the user has been prompted to set Chrome as the default when {CurrentState} is set as the default initially and the total promo count is {PromoCount}. Recorded when the system UI prompting the user to change their default is dismissed.

histogram.name: Android.DefaultBrowserPromo.RoleManagerShown
histogram.summary: Records the default browser state when the Android Q+ role manager dialog is shown.

histogram.name: Android.DesktopWindowHeuristicResult4
histogram.summary: Records the result of the heuristics used to determine whether the app is in a desktop window. The histogram will be emitted only if the result changed since the last time it was emitted. This is to avoid emitting noisy data, since we believe that most of the conditions in these heuristics are unlikely to change for a given OS/OEM across these checks that may be relatively significantly larger in number.

histogram.name: Android.DeviceAuthenticator.AuthSource
histogram.summary: Recorded when a UI surface/flow in Chrome on Android chooses to re-auth the user. It records where the request comes from (Password Manager, Autofill, Incognito or Device Lock Page).

histogram.name: Android.DeviceAuthenticator.CanAuthenticateWithBiometrics
histogram.summary: Recorded when a UI surface/flow in Chrome on Android checks whether biometric authentication is available on the device. It may be called from various places which need to perform biometric re-auth (Password Manager, Autofill, Incognito or Device Lock Page).

histogram.name: Android.DeviceSize.ScreenSizeInTensOfInches
histogram.summary: Records the primary display (screen) size in tens of inches with 0.2 inches (2 units) granularity, during deferred startup. The display size is not affected by Android N multi-window mode.

histogram.name: Android.Display.IsDisplayTopologyAvaialble
histogram.summary: Reports whether usage of the Display Topology Android API on this device is allowed (when AndroidUseDisplayTopology feature flag is enabled and the Android version provides the Display Topology API) or blocked. Recorded once in DisplayAndroidManager.initialize() every time Chrome on Android or Android WebView starts up.

histogram.name: Android.Display.IsNullDisplayRemoved
histogram.summary:
Emitted when DisplayListenerBackend.onDisplayAdded() reports a new sdkDisplayId whose Display descriptor is unexpectedly null. The value records whether that same sdkDisplayId is removed within the next 1 second:
* true - DisplayListenerBackend.onDisplayRemoved() was invoked for the invalid sdkDisplayId within 1 s.
* false No removal occurred, or it happened after 1 s.
Logged once for every onDisplayAdded() call in which the Display descriptor associated with the sdkDisplayId is null.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.ForegroundServiceLifecycle
histogram.summary: Records instances where the foreground undergoes a lifecycle change (when the foreground starts, changes pinned notification, or stops).

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.NotificationInteraction
histogram.summary: Records instances where a user interacts with a download notification (ie. clicks on, pauses, resumes, cancels).

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.OpenSource.Audio
histogram.summary: Records how users open audio download files on Android. This histogram was previously expired on 2023-07-09, and was re-enabled on 2024-02-12.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.OpenSource.Other
histogram.summary: Records the entry point for users opening downloaded files on Android, that are not audio nor video. Records how users open audio download files on Android. This histogram was previously expired on 2023-06-25, and was re-enabled on 2024-02-12.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.OpenSource.Video
histogram.summary: Records how users open video download files on Android. This histogram was previously expired on 2023-06-25, and was re-enabled on 2024-02-12.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.ServiceStopped.DownloadForeground
histogram.summary: Records instances of DownloadForegroundService stops. The number of expected stops (stopped) and unexpected stops (task removed, low memory, etc) can be compared to get a sense of how often the service crashes to see how it handles restarts. For example, the number of times the service is stopped because of low memory can be compared to the number of times the service has been destroyed to see how frequently it occurs. Or, the number of start sticky's will indicate how often the service is able to restart due to an unexpected stop.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.Thumbnail.MaxRequiredStretch.{AndroidDownloadType}
histogram.summary: Records the required stretch of the smaller dimension before displaying an image on download home. Measured in percentage. {AndroidDownloadType}

histogram.name: Android.DownloadPage.OpenSource
histogram.summary: Records the entry point for users opening the download page on Android. This histogram was previously expired on 2023-04-23, and was re-enabled on 2024-02-12.

histogram.name: Android.DragDrop.Files.Count
histogram.summary: Records the number of files included in a drag-drop in chrome. It is recorded on the drop event for a web contents. Android only.

histogram.name: Android.DragDrop.FromWebContent.DropInWebContent.Duration
histogram.summary: Records the duration in ms of drag process when drop happend inside ContentView containing web contents, regardless DragEvent#getResult. Does not capture drag events that end outside the ContentView. Android only.

histogram.name: Android.DragDrop.FromWebContent.TargetType
histogram.summary: Records the type of object being dragged, for the drag process starts from the web content, and drop happens outside of the web content. Does not capture drag events that end inside the ContentView containing web contents. Recorded when such a drag event ends. Android only.

histogram.name: Android.DragDrop.Image.OpenFileTime.FirstAttempt
histogram.summary: Records the duration between receiving Android Drag End event and the first ContentProvider#openFile attempted by the drop target app. The duration is calculated during the first ContentProvider#openFile for each URI. Another metric Android.DragDrop.Image.OpenFileTime.LastAttempt is recorded for the last ContentProvider#openFile. Record 0 if the duration is negative (e.g. ContentProvider#openFile is accessed before drag ends). Android only.

histogram.name: Android.DragDrop.Image.OpenFileTime.FirstExpired
histogram.summary: Records the duration between the URI being cleared and the first ContentProvider#openFile attempt with that expired URI. This is used to evaluate how long we should keep the image data. Because drop target app may retry after Chrome rejects the expired URI; and the retries are not helpful to evaluate how long the data is needed; this metric records at most once per URI. This metric is recorded when Chrome receives an expired URI to retrieve data. If the URI is not the latest expired one, the metric will not be recorded because we do not calculate the elapsed time for older URIs. Android only.

histogram.name: Android.DragDrop.Image.OpenFileTime.LastAttempt
histogram.summary: Records the duration between receiving Android Drag End event and the last ContentProvider#openFile attempted by the drop target app. The duration is calculated when the image data expired at the designated time limit. It is not recorded if the image data is replaced before the time limit due to the start of the next image drag. Another metric Android.DragDrop.Image.OpenFileTime.FirstAttempt is recorded for the first ContentProvider#openFile. Record 0 if the duration is negative (e.g. ContentProvider#openFile is accessed before drag ends). Android only.

histogram.name: Android.DragDrop.Image.Size
histogram.summary: Records the image size being dragged from Chrome. Recorded when start dragging an image from Chrome's web content, regardless of whether drop is handled successfully. Used to evaluate the memory consumption. Android only.

histogram.name: Android.DragDrop.Image.UriCreatedInterval
histogram.summary: Records the interval between two back-to-back image drags. This is used to evaluate the duration to preserve the image data. Android only.

histogram.name: Android.DragDrop.TabOrGroup.MaxInstanceFailureCount
histogram.summary: The number of times tab or group tearing failed for a user, because the maximum number of Chrome instances were open, in a 24-hour period. Recorded when the max-instance toast is shown when a dragged tab or group drop is unhandled at the max instance limit.

histogram.name: Android.DragDrop.ToOmnibox.DropType
histogram.summary: Records the type of object dropped on the Omnibox, as well as whether it originated from Chrome. This metric could be used to determine the total number of uses for drag and drop to Omnibox, and specifics on how much each data type is being dropped. Android only.

histogram.name: Android.DragDrop{TabObjectType}.FromStrip.Result
histogram.summary: Records the {TabObjectType} drag and drop results, including successful drops and failed drops with varied reasons. For failed drops, it is recorded during ACTION_DROP. For successful drops, it is recorded during ACTION_DRAG_ENDED. Note that the successful drops count can be recorded more often than Android.DragDrop.Tab.Type or Android.DragDrop.TabGroup.Type such as reorder within strip or tabs being consumed as text by EditText in native pages.

histogram.name: Android.DragDrop{TabObjectType}.FromStrip.Result.DesktopWindow
histogram.summary: Records the {TabObjectType} drag and drop results in desktop windowing mode, including successful drops and failed drops with varied reasons. For failed drops, it is recorded during ACTION_DROP. For successful drops, it is recored during ACTION_DRAG_ENDED. Note that the successful drops count can be recorded more often than Android.DragDrop.Tab.Type.DesktopWindow or Android.DragDrop.TabGroup.Type.DesktopWindow, such as reorder within strip or tabs being consumed as text by EditText in native pages.

histogram.name: Android.DragDrop{TabObjectType}.ReorderStripWithDragDrop
histogram.summary: Records {TabObjectType} drops into source strip with or without leaving the strip. True means the drag has left the source strip; while false means it does not. Recorded when drop into source strip. Used to determine the amount of accidental drag out of the strip.

histogram.name: Android.DragDrop{TabObjectType}.SourceWindowClosed
histogram.summary: Records true when a {TabObjectType} drag/drop results in closing the source Chrome window because it was the last {TabObjectType} in the window, false when the drop does not close the source window. Only recorded when drag/drop is handled.

histogram.name: Android.DragDrop{TabObjectType}.Type
histogram.summary: Records the drag source and drop target when a {TabObjectType} is dropped successfully.

histogram.name: Android.DragDrop{TabObjectType}.Type.DesktopWindow
histogram.summary: Records the drag source and drop target when a {TabObjectType} is dropped successfully in desktop windowing mode.

histogram.name: Android.DynamicTopChrome.TabStripTransition.Finished
histogram.summary: On tablets, when the width of the tab strip passes a certain threshold, the tab strip will start a transition to show / hide it from the top toolbar. This records true when tab strip transition finishes successfully, or false when a new transition starts before an ongoing transition dispatched the finished signal.

histogram.name: Android.DynamicTopChrome.WindowResize.DesktopWindowModeState
histogram.summary: Records the desktop windowing mode state when the Chrome window is resized on tablet or foldable devices.

histogram.name: Android.EdgeToEdge.BackupNavbarInsets.EdgeToEdgeController
histogram.summary: Records the source, if applicable, used to provide back-up navbar insets to the EdgeToEdgeController. The EdgeToEdgeController will request back-up insets once every time it receives a window inset update, if the navigation bar insets are 0.

histogram.name: Android.EdgeToEdge.Debugging.ConfigurationSwitchOutcome
histogram.summary: Records when the EdgeToEdgeControllerImpl notices a change when edge-to-edge is changed from a supported configuration into unsupported. Record the outcome combination of the original window insets, new window insets, and paddings applied to the content view.

histogram.name: Android.EdgeToEdge.Debugging.SupportedConfigurationStrangeInsets
histogram.summary: Records when the EdgeToEdgeControllerImpl handles insets and observes that the configuration seems to support edge-to-edge, but other inset signals (other than the supported configuration check) seem to disagree.

histogram.name: Android.EdgeToEdge.DrawToEdgeInUnsupportedConfiguration
histogram.summary: Records when EdgeToEdgeControllerImpl#drawToEdge gets called on a device whose configuration does not support edge-to-edge, with the boolean record indicating whether drawToEdge was called due to a change in window state.

histogram.name: Android.EdgeToEdge.Eligible
histogram.summary: Records whether the current session is eligible for drawing any content edge to edge. Recorded on ChromeActivity launch.

histogram.name: Android.EdgeToEdge.IneligibilityReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason of why the current session is not eligibile for drawing any content edge to edge. Multiple reasons might be record for a single session. Recorded on ChromeActivity launch.

histogram.name: Android.EdgeToEdge.MissingNavbarInsets2
histogram.summary: Records once during the initialization of the EdgeToEdgeControllerImpl whether there were no navigation bar insets at all, which may indicate an incorrect value from the OS.

histogram.name: Android.EdgeToEdge.NavigationBarMandatoryGesturesMismatch
histogram.summary: Records when insets are updated and the mandatory system gestures insets seem to indicate the presence of a navigation bar, but the navigation bar insets (ignoring visibility) are zero. This is recorded up to three times per session: once if there's a mismatch in the first insets received by the app, once on the first time those mismatched insets are corrected (non-zero navbar insets), and once if insets are mismatched after non-zero navbar insets have been seen during the current session. The enum value also tracks the navigation mode (gesture, tappable) indicated by the insets, or if the insets are giving mixed signals on the navigation mode.

histogram.name: Android.EdgeToEdge.SupportedConfigurationSwitch2
histogram.summary: Records when the EdgeToEdgeControllerImpl notices a change in whether edge-to-edge is supported by the device configuration when it handles a change in window insets. This is recorded once every time a change is detected.

histogram.name: Android.Event.ActionDown
histogram.summary: Records the input device source for the action down touch event.

histogram.name: Android.FamilyLinkUser.LocalWebApprovalParentAuthenticationError
histogram.units: Status error codes raised in GMS Core
histogram.summary: The different GMS error status codes that a user may encounter during the parent authentication step in the local web approval flow. Recorded on Android only. See go/chrome-local-web-approval-parent-auth-error-codes (Googlers only) for the error code definitions. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-06-13 to 2023-07-28; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Android.FocusChanged.FocusOwningWebContents
histogram.summary: Records whether the WebContents associated with the RenderWidgetHost responsible for handling input is focused specifically on TouchStart or GestureTap or MouseDown events. This histogram is recorded for each input event sequence on TouchStart/GestureTap/MouseDown input events. This would help us in understanding if focus changes on input events need to be handled by Viz once it starts receiving transferred input events after InputVizard (go/chrome-inputvizard).

histogram.name: Android.FocusChanged.RenderWidgetHostViewChildFrame.RootViewFocusState
histogram.summary: Tracks if the RenderWidgetHostViewChildFrame requests focus on the root RenderWidgetHostViewAndroid or not during the beginning of a touch interaction. This tracking occurs every time the function RenderWidgetHostViewChildFrame::PreProcessTouchEvent() is called when a touch sequence begins (on TouchStart). This would help us in understanding if focus changes on touch input events need to be handled by Viz once it starts receiving transferred input events after InputVizard (go/chrome-inputvizard).

histogram.name: Android.FontLookup.Blink.DLFontsLatencyFailure2
histogram.summary: Records the latency of looking up a local font from Android downloadable fonts at the time of instantiating the font in the fonts backend in the renderer. Includes time for error checking and attempting to create the font from the retrieved blob, if there is one. Only records timings for situations in which a font could not be instantiated. This is recorded only on devices that support high resolution timers.

histogram.name: Android.FontLookup.Blink.DLFontsLatencySuccess2
histogram.summary: Records the latency of looking up a local font from Android downloadable fonts at the time of instantiating the font in the fonts backend in the renderer. Includes time for error checking and attempting to create the font from the retrieved blob, if there is one. Only records timings for situations in which a font was successfully instantiated and returned. This is recorded only on devices that support high resolution timers.

histogram.name: Android.FontLookup.Blink.GetTableLatency
histogram.summary: Records the latency of fetching the font name lookup table from the browser. The table is cached by the renderer so will usually only be fetched once per renderer startup. This is recorded when an attempt is made to fetch the table, typically once per renderer on the first font lookup for that process. If the original fetch fails, this will be recorded the next time a font lookup is requested.

histogram.name: Android.FontLookup.FetchAllFontFiles.Time
histogram.summary: Records the time taken to fetch all available font files from the GMS Core Android downloadable font provider.

histogram.name: Android.FontLookup.GmsFontRequest.Time
histogram.summary: Records the time taken to make a fetchFonts font request to GMS Core via the Android downloadable font provider API. This metric may be used to determine whether it's reasonable to execute this task on the IO thread rather than posting to a background thread.

histogram.name: Android.FontLookup.MatchLocalFontByUniqueName.Time
histogram.summary: Records the time taken to respond to a request from the renderer to fetch a specific font file from the GMS Core Android downloadable font provider.

histogram.name: Android.GridTabSwitcher.Animation.FirstFrameLatency.{GridTabSwitcherAnimationType}
histogram.summary: This histogram records the time taken between the tab and tab switcher layout. Timing starts when the layout transition begins and ends on the first frame. This is recorded each time the layout transition animation occurs. {GridTabSwitcherAnimationType}

histogram.name: Android.GridTabSwitcher.Animation.TotalDuration.{GridTabSwitcherAnimationType}
histogram.summary: This histogram records the time taken between the tab and tab switcher layout. Timing starts when the layout transition begins and ends on the last frame. This is recorded each time the layout transition animation occurs. {GridTabSwitcherAnimationType}

histogram.name: Android.GridTabSwitcher.ThumbnailFetchingResult
histogram.summary: This histogram records the result of thumbnail fetching in the Grid Tab Switcher on Android. This is recorded once per thumbnail fetch when a Tab card with a thumbnail is shown onscreen.

histogram.name: Android.GridTabSwitcher.TimeToTabStateInitializedFromShown
histogram.summary: Records the elapsed realtime in milliseconds between the tab switcher being shown and the tab state being initialized. This is not recorded if the tab state was already initialized. Recorded at most once per session once the tab state is initialized.

histogram.name: Android.Hub.PaneFocused
histogram.summary: Reports which pane in the Hub becomes focused when a request to change focus occurs. Focus may change either in response to user input on the pane switcher or programmatically as a side-effect of another user action. For example the see all tabs button on the Incognito reauth dialog. See "Android.Hub.PaneFocused.PaneSwitcher" if only interested in user actions on the pane switcher.

histogram.name: Android.Hub.PaneFocused.PaneSwitcher
histogram.summary: Reports which pane in the Hub becomes focused when a request to change focus occurs in response to a user input on the pane switcher. This does not count programmatic pane switches triggered as a side effect of other user actions such as the back button, Incognito reauth dialog, etc. See "Android.Hub.PaneFocused" for all pane focus events.

histogram.name: Android.Hub.ToolbarPresentOnAnimation
histogram.summary: The shrink/expand animation is supposed to change the color of the toolbar. But there's currently a rare crash where the toolbar is not present. Either it hasn't been created yet or has already been torn down. This metric captures if the toolbar is present or not, which should help us measure the effectiveness of future mitigations.

histogram.name: Android.HubSearch.SearchBoxEntrypointV2
histogram.summary: Reports under which context (incognito or non-incognito) and visual component (search box or loupe) Hub Search is entered through. This includes tablet specific data which only has the loupe icon enabled.

histogram.name: Android.IncognitoNotification.FileNotDeleted
histogram.summary: Records the count of any cases when clicking on the "Close all Incognito tabs" notification may not delete any files which were opened in the Incognito session. True value denotes file was not deleted and false otherwise.

histogram.name: Android.IncognitoReauth.AuthResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of the attempt to re-auth the user via biometrics or device lock for the Incognito re-auth screen.

histogram.name: Android.IncognitoReauth.PrefToggledFromSettingPage
histogram.summary: Records the count when the Incognito lock setting was either turned "on" or "off" from the Chrome Settings > Privacy and Security > Lock Incognito tabs when you leave Chrome, option. This setting can be in disabled state if the Android screen lock is not set-up, in which case we don't record this metric. This is recorded only when the toggle is not in disabled state and if the re-authentication checks succeeds which follows after the user changes the toggle. This covers only the interactions done from the above mentioned Incognito lock Setting page. See also the metric "Android.IncognitoReauth.PromoActionType" which records the opt-in made exclusively from promo card.

histogram.name: Android.IncognitoReauth.PromoAcceptedOrDismissed
histogram.summary: Records the action type the user makes on the Incognito re-auth promo card which is shown inside the Incognito tab grid view. There's only two possible interactions possible which is either to turn on the Incognito lock or dismiss the promo. A "Promo accepted" entry is emitted when user clicks on "Turn on Incognito lock" (gated on successful re-authentication) and a "No thanks" value is emitted when the user clicks on "No thanks".

histogram.name: Android.IncognitoReauth.PromoImpressionAfterActionCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of impressions of the Incognito re-auth promo card when user clicks accept or dismiss or when the promo expires after the max number of impressions.

histogram.name: Android.IncognitoReauth.ToggleOnOrOff
histogram.summary: Records the Incognito lock setting state (if available to clients) exactly once during the browser startup, after the native code is initialized. Note, for multi-windows this histogram would be emitted as many times as the users enter multi-window(s).

histogram.name: Android.InputDevice.Keyboard.Active
histogram.summary: Emitted when a hardware keyboard is connected or disconnected.

histogram.name: Android.InputDevice.Mouse.Active
histogram.summary: Emitted when a mouse is connected or disconnected.

histogram.name: Android.InputHintChecker.InitializationResult
histogram.summary: Every time the native message loop yields to the Looper record whether it dispatches some input event referring to touch in the content area before returning back to the native message loop. The latter scenario may mean that the touch event was dispatched to the Android UI views. Alternatively, it can happen when the Looper decided to run the message loop handler first.

histogram.name: Android.InputHintChecker.InputHintResult
histogram.summary:
Records the status of the InputHintChecker initialization. This initialization procedure is required to be able to later poll for availability of unhandled input events queued. Recorded immediately after finishing the initialization, which should happen once during early browser process initialization.
A failure may be recorded after initialization succeeds (which itself records a sample) if reading the input hint fails. In this case only the first failure is recorded.
Note: This metric became randomly subsampled in M136 (136.0.7064.0) to reduce overhead. The low data volume warning on the dashboard for this transition can be ignored.

histogram.name: Android.InputOnViz.Browser.EventsAfterTransfer
histogram.summary: The metric is only recorded when touch sequence is successfully transferred from Browser to Viz(when InputOnViz feature flag is enabled). The histogram is emitted for discrete events seen between inital DOWN on which transfer was requested, and the CANCEL received corresponding to DOWN from Android, excluding both of these events.

histogram.name: Android.InputOnViz.Browser.EventTypesInDroppedSequence
histogram.summary: The metric is recorded when a touch sequence in Browser fails to transfer while while there's a potentially ongoing touch sequence on Viz. The metric records the type of event that was dropped.

histogram.name: Android.InputOnViz.Browser.NumEventsInDroppedSequence
histogram.summary: The metric is recorded when a touch sequence in Browser fails to transfer while while there's a potentially ongoing touch sequence on Viz. The metric records the number of events lost in such cases.

histogram.name: Android.InputOnViz.Browser.SequenceDroppedReason
histogram.summary:
Obsolete metric, replaced by Android.InputOnViz.Browser.SequenceDroppedReason2.
Records the reason a touch sequence was dropped on browser process while InputOnViz was enabled. A dropped touch sequence would have not have any affect on web contents, the input events never get transferred over to Renderer for such a sequence.
The histogram is emitted every time a touch sequence is dropped on Browser procoess due to various reasons, when InputOnViz feature is enabled.
`Android.InputOnViz.Browser.EventTypesInDroppedSequence` and `Android.InputOnViz.Browser.NumEventsInDroppedSequence` could be used to know what type of events exist in dropped sequences and the number of events in these dropped sequences.

histogram.name: Android.InputOnViz.Browser.SequenceDroppedReason2
histogram.summary:
Records the reason a touch sequence was dropped on browser process while InputOnViz was enabled. A dropped touch sequence would have not have any affect on web contents, the input events never get transferred over to Renderer for such a sequence.
The histogram is emitted every time a touch sequence is dropped on Browser procoess due to various reasons, when InputOnViz feature is enabled.
`Android.InputOnViz.Browser.EventTypesInDroppedSequence` and `Android.InputOnViz.Browser.NumEventsInDroppedSequence` could be used to know what type of events exist in dropped sequences and the number of events in these dropped sequences.

histogram.name: Android.InputOnViz.Browser.TouchMovesSeenAfterTransfer
histogram.summary: The metric is only recorded when touch sequence is successfully transferred from Browser to Viz(when InputOnViz feature flag is enabled). It records the number of touch moves received on Browser before receiving a TOUCH_CANCEL, which would be the last event Browser sees for that sequence after a successful transfer.

histogram.name: Android.InputOnViz.Browser.TransferInputToVizResult2
histogram.summary:
The metric is only recorded when transfer of input sequence from Browser to Viz is supported.
It records the result of transferring input sequence from Browser. The sequence can be handled by Browser/Viz based on various factors like if Ime is active, or touch selection is active, etc. V2 adds the kSharedMemoryUnavailable and kPositiveEventAndDownTimeDelta bucket.

histogram.name: Android.InputOnViz.InputReceiverCreationResult
histogram.summary: Records result of InputReceiver creation on Viz. When Android returns null pointer to some of the API calls made, input receiver creation API call cannot be issued. This histogram tracks if input receiver creation was successful or failed due to some reason.

histogram.name: Android.InputOnViz.Viz.DroppedKeyEvent.Type
histogram.summary: Records the type of key event as gotten from `AInputEvent_getType` Android NDK API. Viz is not exepcted to receive key events, but in practice it does due to races in focus handling at startup. All the key events received on Viz are dropped and reported in this histogram.

histogram.name: Android.InputOnViz.Viz.DroppedNonTouchActions
histogram.summary: Records the actions of input events that were dropped on Viz due to lack of implementation. Viz expects to only handle touch events which means it doesn't expect to see actions like button down/release.

histogram.name: Android.InputOnViz.Viz.DroppedSequences.EventAndDownTimeDelta
histogram.summary: For dropped touch sequences, records the delta between event time and down time for the ACTION_DOWN event. This is recorded when a touch down for a sequence is dropped on Viz.

histogram.name: Android.InputOnViz.Viz.PendingStateTransfers.{CurrentState}
histogram.summary:
When `InputOnViz` is enabled Browser process sends state on TouchDown to Viz in case touch transfer was successful. In theory, due to hiccups in system we can have multiple pending states on Viz.
This metric records the number of pending states on Viz when {CurrentState}. This would help us verify if we have pending states in practice as well.

histogram.name: Android.InputOnViz.Viz.SequenceDroppedReason
histogram.summary:
Viz side variant of `Android.InputOnViz.Browser.SequenceDroppedReason2` histogram.
The metric records whenever a touch sequence is dropped on Viz side.

histogram.name: Android.InputOnViz.Viz.StateProcessingResult3
histogram.summary:
Records what happened to state received on Viz, upon successful transfer of a touch sequence the Browser process sends over touch transfer state for Viz to handle input sequence.
Compared to `Android.InputOnViz.Viz.StateProcessingResult2`, version 3 of histogram further splits some of the `ProcessedSuccessfully` cases into `TransferBackToBrowserSuccessfully` and `DroppedTransferBackToBrowserFailed` buckets.

histogram.name: Android.InputStream.TotalRead.SizeKB
histogram.summary: Records how much data has been transferred through embedder_support::InputStream. Recorded when that object is destroyed.

histogram.name: Android.InstalledApp.RelatedAppType
histogram.summary: Records the app type of a getInstalledRelatedApps request, for each app being checked.

histogram.name: Android.Intent.HasNonSpoofablePackageName
histogram.summary: Android only. Boolean histogram denoting whether the package name can be retrieved in a non-spoofable way from the View Intents sent to Chrome. When the histogram returns true, it means we can confirm the package name was passed by the defined host app. Emitted upon launching the tabbed Chrome Activity via View Intent.

histogram.name: Android.Intent.IdentityShared
histogram.summary: Android only. Boolean histogram denoting whether the package name is available by the sender sharing its identity using the new API introduced in Android U. This means we can confirm the package name was passed by the defined host app. Emitted upon launching the tabbed Chrome Activity via View Intent.

histogram.name: Android.Intent.IntentLaunchFromTabCreation
histogram.summary:
Records whether a tab was created due to an external app to launch an intent for an external app.
The false counts, and thus the PDF, for this metric is not meaningful. Instead, utilize the true counts with another such as MobileStartup.LaunchCause.EXTERNAL_VIEW_INTENT as the denominator to determine the proportion of redirects.

histogram.name: Android.Intent.InterceptNavigationDeferDuration
histogram.summary:
Records the duration of a deferred navigation due to the InterceptNavigationThrottle, every time a navigation is deferred.
At time of writing, this can only be caused by the ExternalNavigationHandler on Android, and should only happen when background/early navigations redirect.

histogram.name: Android.Intent.MainFrameIntentLaunch
histogram.summary: Recorded when an external app is launched as the result of a navigation. Records the source and scheme of the navigation.

histogram.name: Android.Intent.OverrideBrowserAuxiliaryNavigation
histogram.summary: It records whether a new auxiliary browsing context navigation would be overridden by preventing any intent launch and causing the navigation to stay in the browser by opening a new tab instead.

histogram.name: Android.Intent.ShareIntentUrlCount
histogram.summary: Number of URLs present in Text Share intents (ACTION_SEND) received by Chrome.

histogram.name: Android.IsolatedSplits.ClassLoaderReplaced.{AndroidFeatureModuleName}
Android.IsolatedSplits.ContextCreateTime2.{AndroidFeatureModuleName}
histogram.summary: Amount of time it takes to create a new Context for a split. This will only be recorded if isolated splits are enabled. Different from ContextCreateTime as only the first load of a split will be counted. {AndroidFeatureModuleName}

histogram.name: Android.IsolatedSplits.ContextCreateTime3.{AndroidFeatureModuleName}
Android.IsolatedSplits.LoadFirstClassTime.{AndroidFeatureModuleName}
Android.IsolatedSplits.PreloadWaitTime.{AndroidFeatureModuleName}
Android.Jank.AsyncTaskGetOnUiThreadStatus
histogram.summary:
The status of an AsyncTask when get() is called on the UI thread. This is only recorded if the AsyncTask isn't immediately available.
Seeing the distribution of PENDING vs RUNNING tasks will give us a better idea for how to approach these hangs.

histogram.name: Android.KernelVersion
histogram.summary: Reports the kernel major and minor version from the utsname.release field. The low 16 bits of each version are combined into a 32-bit integer. The range is from [0x00020006,0x0004000a] to track kernel versions 2.6 through 4.10.

histogram.name: Android.LibraryLoader.Prefetch.Duration
histogram.summary: The time for prefetching the native library code to memory. Recorded once per process start when prefetching is used.

histogram.name: Android.LibraryLoader.Prefetch.ForkDuration
histogram.summary:
Time taken to perform the fork() call in the library prefetcher when using the PrefetchWithFork strategy. This measures the duration of the clone syscall from the parent process, not the lifetime of the child process. The whole parent process (not just the calling thread) can be blocked for this duration, so this can represent a delay in startup.
This is emitted regardless of whether the fork/prefetch succeeds, though it is extremely rare for the fork itself to fail (see the .Status histogram).
Emitted during native library prefetch (normally in renderer process init), only for Android WebView and only when the LibraryPrefetcherMadvise feature is disabled.

histogram.name: Android.LibraryLoader.Prefetch.Madvise
histogram.summary:
True iff madvise MADV_WILLNEED is supported (and will be used to prefetch the native library). Does not state whether madvise was successful for the actual prefetch (see Android.LibraryLoader.Prefetch.Status instead.)
Emitted during native library prefetch (normally in renderer process init), only for Android WebView and only when the LibraryPrefetcherMadvise feature is enabled.

histogram.name: Android.LibraryLoader.Prefetch.Status
histogram.summary: Reports the result of prefetching native code into memory. Recorded once per process start when prefetching is used.

histogram.name: Android.MaybeCopyContentAreaAsBitmap.Time
histogram.summary: Measures how long the MaybeCopyContentAreaAsBitmap function takes. This is emitted only when a navigation entry screenshot is captured.

histogram.name: Android.MediaPickerShown
histogram.summary: Recorded once per batch of files uploaded, when Chrome has made the determination of what media picker to show to the user.

histogram.name: Android.MemoryPressureNotification{AndroidProcessType}
histogram.summary: Memory pressure notifications sent by Android through ComponentCallbacks2. This metric was added 04/2018; for prior data for the browser process see MemoryAndroid.NotificationBackground and MemoryAndroid.NotificationForeground. {AndroidProcessType}

histogram.name: Android.Messages.DismissedWithoutFullyVisible
histogram.summary: Records the message identifier when the message is dismissed without being fully visible before. This only tracks the case in which message is dismissed by primary action, secondary action, gesture and timer.

histogram.name: Android.Messages.Dismissed{MessageIdentifier}
histogram.summary: Recorded once per message when the message is dismissed to capture the dismissal reason (e.g. primary button tap, timeout). The histogram can be used for measuring user engagement with messages of different types.

histogram.name: Android.Messages.Enqueued
histogram.summary: Records the message identifier each time a message is enqueued through MessageDispatcher (the entry point to Chrome for Android's messages system). This histogram can be used for getting a count of messages broken down by message identifier.

histogram.name: Android.Messages.Enqueued.Hidden
histogram.summary: Records the message identifier when an enqueued message is not immediately displayed either because there is another message on the secreen or because message scope (e.g. tab) is not active. This metric is recorded along with Android.Messages.Enqueued.Hiding, which records identifier of currently visible message.

histogram.name: Android.Messages.Enqueued.Hiding
histogram.summary: Recorded when an enqueued message is not immediately displayed. This metric records message identifier of a message currently displayed on the screen (that prevented the enqueued message from getting displayed immediately). INVALID_MESSAGE is recorded when the message isn't displayed because message scope (e.g. tab) isn't active or when message queue is suspended.

histogram.name: Android.Messages.Enqueued.Visible
histogram.summary: Records the message identifier when a message is displayed immediately when it is enqueued. This includes cases when there are no other messages on the screen as well as cases when the new message is high priority and causes some other message to hide.

histogram.name: Android.Messages.Enqueued.{QueueState}
histogram.summary: Records the message identifier when it is enqueued while the queue is {QueueState}.

histogram.name: Android.Messages.Enqueued.{ScopeState}
histogram.summary: Records the message identifier when it is enqueued while its associated scope is {ScopeState}.

histogram.name: Android.Messages.FullyVisible
histogram.summary: Records the message identifier every time it becomes fully visible to users. Can be recorded multiple times during its lifetime.

histogram.name: Android.Messages.Stacking
histogram.summary: Records the type of stacking animation when it is triggered. The type indicates the relation between current displayed messages and incoming messages.

histogram.name: Android.Messages.Stacking.Hidden
histogram.summary: Records the message identifier of the back message which is hidden by the foreground message. Emits when the stacking animation is about to start.

histogram.name: Android.Messages.Stacking.Hiding
histogram.summary: Records the message identifier of the front message which is hiding the background message. Emits when the stacking animation is about to start.

histogram.name: Android.Messages.Stacking.RequestToFullyShow
histogram.summary: Records the id of front message when the candidate requests to show. The recorded message is not guranteed to be displayed: it might be blocked by unready browser control or unintialized container.

histogram.name: Android.Messages.Stacking.{Action}
histogram.summary: Records the message identifier when {Action} during a stacking animation.

variant.name: InsertAtBack
variant.summary: a message is inserted at back.

variant.name: InsertAtFront
variant.summary: a message is inserted at front.

variant.name: PushToBack
variant.summary: a front message is pushed to back.

variant.name: PushToFront
variant.summary: a back message is pushed to front.

histogram.name: Android.Messages.TimeToAction.Dismiss{MessageIdentifier}
histogram.summary: Records the time interval the message was displayed on the screen before the user dismissed it with a gesture. The metric is NOT recorded when the user presses primary or secondary button or when the message is auto-dismissed based on timer. The interval includes both enter and exit animation. The metric can be used to analyze the time threshold for the user to give up waiting for autodismiss timer and dismiss the message explicitly.

histogram.name: Android.Messages.TimeToAction{MessageIdentifier}
histogram.summary: Records the time interval the message was displayed on the screen before the user explicitly dismissed it. The metric is recorded when the user presses primary or secondary button, or dismisses the message with a gesture. It is not recorded when the message is auto-dismissed based on timer. The interval includes both enter and exit animation. The metric can be used to analyze the amount of time it takes for the user to understand the message and take an action (e.g. click a button, dismiss the message, etc.).

histogram.name: Android.Messages.TimeToFullyShow{MessageIdentifier}
histogram.summary: Recorded once per message measuring the duration from the moment it is enqueued to the first time it becomes fully shown. Recorded when the message becomes fully shown.

histogram.name: Android.MultiInstance.MaxInstanceCount
histogram.summary: The maximum number of Chrome instances that ran at the same time in a 24-hour period. Checked whenever there is an activity state change to log the stats once in 24 hours.

histogram.name: Android.MultiInstance.MaxInstanceCountIncognito
histogram.summary: The maximum number of Chrome Incognito-only instances that ran at the same time in a 24-hour period. Checked whenever there is an activity state change to log the stats once in 24 hours.
