histogram.name: Android.MultiInstance.MaxWindowLimitExceeded
histogram.summary: Records the exceeded status when attempted to open a new chrome window. The value is set to true when attempted to exceed the maximum number of allowed chrome windows, the value is set to false otherwise. See also related metrics "Android.MultiInstance.NumActivities" and "Android.MultiInstance.NumInstances" which record the count of windows.

histogram.name: Android.MultiInstance.NumActivities
histogram.summary: Records the number of running ChromeTabbedActivity's on every ChromeTabbedActivity startup. This includes activities that may not be visible on screen (i.e. it includes ChromeTabbedActivity's in the "stopped" state). This does not include ChromeTabbedActivity's that have been destroyed regardless of whether their owning Android Task may be retrieved in Android Recents. Applicable to Android S+ only.

histogram.name: Android.MultiInstance.NumActivities.DesktopWindow
histogram.summary: Records the number of running ChromeTabbedActivity's on every ChromeTabbedActivity startup in a desktop window. This includes activities that may not be visible on screen (i.e. it includes ChromeTabbedActivity's in the "stopped" state). This does not include ChromeTabbedActivity's that have been destroyed regardless of whether their owning Android Task may be retrieved in Android Recents. Applicable to Android V+ only.

histogram.name: Android.MultiInstance.NumActivities.DesktopWindow.Incognito
histogram.summary: Records the number of running Incognito-only ChromeTabbedActivity's on every ChromeTabbedActivity startup in a desktop window. This includes activities that may not be visible on screen (i.e. it includes ChromeTabbedActivity's in the "stopped" state). This does not include ChromeTabbedActivity's that have been destroyed regardless of whether their owning Android Task may be retrieved in Android Recents. Applicable to Android V+ only.

histogram.name: Android.MultiInstance.NumActivities.Incognito
histogram.summary: Records the number of running Incognito-only ChromeTabbedActivity's on every ChromeTabbedActivity startup. This includes activities that may not be visible on screen (i.e. it includes ChromeTabbedActivity's in the "stopped" state). This does not include ChromeTabbedActivity's that have been destroyed regardless of whether their owning Android Task may be retrieved in Android Recents. Applicable to Android S+ only.

histogram.name: Android.MultiInstance.NumInstances
histogram.summary: The number of allocated instance IDs which corresponds to the number of retrievable Chrome instances (aka windows). An instance is considered retrievable if it has tab state data on disk irrespective of whether that data is currently assigned to a running ChromeTabbedActivity. These instances may be retrieved from Chrome's in-app window manager from Android Recents if they are associated with a live ChromeTabbedActivity or Android Task. Recorded on every ChromeTabbedActivity start-up. Applicable to Android S+ only.

histogram.name: Android.MultiInstance.NumInstances.DesktopWindow
histogram.summary: The number of allocated instance IDs which corresponds to the number of retrievable Chrome instances (aka windows). An instance is considered retrievable if it has tab state data on disk irrespective of whether that data is currently assigned to a running ChromeTabbedActivity. These instances may be retrieved from Chrome's in-app window manager from Android Recents if they are associated with a live ChromeTabbedActivity or Android Task. Recorded on every ChromeTabbedActivity start-up in a desktop window. Applicable to Android V+ only.

histogram.name: Android.MultiInstance.NumInstances.DesktopWindow.Incognito
histogram.summary: The number of allocated Incognito-only instance IDs which corresponds to the number of retrievable Chrome instances (aka windows). An instance is considered retrievable if it has tab state data on disk irrespective of whether that data is currently assigned to a running ChromeTabbedActivity. These instances may be retrieved from Chrome's in-app window manager from Android Recents if they are associated with a live ChromeTabbedActivity or Android Task. Recorded on every ChromeTabbedActivity start-up in a desktop window. Applicable to Android V+ only.

histogram.name: Android.MultiInstance.NumInstances.Incognito
histogram.summary: The number of allocated Incognito-only instance IDs which corresponds to the number of retrievable Chrome instances (aka windows). An instance is considered retrievable if it has tab state data on disk irrespective of whether that data is currently assigned to a running ChromeTabbedActivity. These instances may be retrieved from Chrome's in-app window manager from Android Recents if they are associated with a live ChromeTabbedActivity or Android Task. Recorded on every ChromeTabbedActivity start-up. Applicable to Android S+ only.

histogram.name: Android.MultiInstance.WindowManager.DesktopWindowModeState
histogram.summary: Records the desktop windowing mode state when the Chrome window manager is opened from the app menu.

histogram.name: Android.MultipleUserProfilesState
histogram.summary:
Records whether multiple user profiles are present in Android.
This is recorded every time a metrics log is created.

histogram.name: Android.MultiWindowMode.Active
histogram.summary: Records on every metrics upload whether the activity is running in Android N multi-window mode or not.

histogram.name: Android.MultiWindowMode.AssertIndicesMatch.PreExistingActivityDestroyed
histogram.summary:
When the TabWindowManager allocates a different tab model index than the window Id selected by MultiInstanceManagerApi31, it means the requested tab model Id was assigned to a different Activity.
When this mismatch happened, if an activity is found at the requested index, track the state recorded in "Android.MultiWindowMode.AssertIndicesMatch", and attach a ActivityStateListener. When the observed Activity's #onDestroy is called, record the tracked state at the time the observer is attached.

histogram.name: Android.MultiWindowMode.AssertIndicesMatch{ActivityIndexMismatchAssignmentState}
histogram.summary:
When the TabWindowManager allocates a different tab model index than the window Id selected by MultiInstanceManagerApi31, it means the requested tab model Id was assigned to a different Activity.
When this mismatch happened, record whether the activity at the requested index is finishing, whether it is in the same task as the new activity, and if it's still visible in ActivityManager#getAppTasks. Record "Unknown" if the activity cannot be found. Recorded when the mismatched index for the new activity is {ActivityIndexMismatchAssignmentState}.

histogram.name: Android.MultiWindowMode.CloseWindow.AppSource
histogram.summary: Records the source of instance closure, emitted when permanent instance state deletion is requested. Note that this does not account for Android system-initiated closures or closures due to user actions on system UI.

histogram.name: Android.MultiWindowMode.Configuration
histogram.summary: Records the configuration of the window that the app is running in. The histogram will be emitted when a window is created, and when the windowing mode changes. Recorded for tablet form factors only when desktop windowing is supported.

histogram.name: Android.MultiWindowMode.DraggedTabOpenedNewWindow
histogram.summary: Recorded when a new Chrome window is created from a dragged tab. The histogram records true when the dragged tab is successfully reparented to the new window, false when the reparenting of the dragged tab is not done.

histogram.name: Android.MultiWindowMode.MismatchedIndices.ActivityCreationTimeDelta
histogram.summary:
When the TabWindowManager allocates a different tab model index than the window Id selected by MultiInstanceManagerApi31, it means the requested tab model Id was assigned to a different Activity.
When this mismatch happened, record the difference in creation timestamps of both activities that are attempting to use the same index.

histogram.name: Android.MultiWindowMode.MismatchedIndices.TimeToPreExistingActivityDestruction
histogram.summary:
When the TabWindowManager allocates a different tab model index than the window Id selected by MultiInstanceManagerApi31, it means the requested tab model Id was assigned to a different Activity.
When this mismatch happened, if #onDestroy is called for an activity found at the requested index, record the time it took for this activity to get destroyed after the mismatch was reported.

histogram.name: Android.MultiWindowMode.NewWindow.AppSource
histogram.summary: Records trigger source when a new window creation is requested.

histogram.name: Android.MultiWindowMode.PopupBoundsAdjustment.Delta{Axis}.Outcome.{CrossDisplay}
histogram.summary: After a contextual popup is spawned we may adjust its bounds so that size of the website viewport is as requested by the caller in the |window.open()| Javascript call. This records whether the absolute difference in {Axis} between initial popup bounds and adjusted popup bounds was zero pixels. The popup was opened on {CrossDisplay} its originating window.

histogram.name: Android.MultiWindowMode.PopupBoundsAdjustment.Delta{Axis}.Positive.{CrossDisplay}
histogram.summary: After a contextual popup is spawned we may adjust its bounds so that size of the website viewport is as requested by the caller in the |window.open()| Javascript call. This records the absolute difference in {Axis} between initial popup bounds and adjusted popup bounds. Records only positive differences. The popup was opened on {CrossDisplay} its originating window.

histogram.name: Android.MultiWindowMode.PopupOpensInNewWindow
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of a |window.open()| JavaScript call that should open a new popup window. Recorded only when the |window.open()| call is guaranteed to be executed one way or another (i.e. does not record anything when popup blocker drops the request). If the popup is not opened in a new window, it is most likely opened as a new tab.

histogram.name: Android.MultiWindowMode.TotalDuration
histogram.summary: Total time spent in Android N+ multi-window (aka split-screen) mode. Recorded when multi-window mode is exited.

histogram.name: Android.MultiWindowMode.{WindowingMode}.Duration
histogram.summary: Total time spent in {WindowingMode} mode in a given 24-hour period. The histogram will be emitted for a previous emission cycle when an activity in any windowing mode is stopped after more than 24 hours have elapsed since the start of this emission cycle.

histogram.name: Android.NTP.Impression
histogram.summary: Counts impressions of the NTP on Android. It also counts potential impressions. A potential impression is a place where it would make sense to open the NTP instead of the current view. E.g. the no-tab view is counted as a potential impression since this view could be replaced with the NTP. For better comparison regular impressions are also counted. The no-tab view counting happens right after the user closed the last tab and the regular impression counting happens at construction time of the NTP (=whenever a new tab is opened).

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.ActionInSuggest.IntentResult
histogram.summary:
Records the outcome of the User's interaction with ActionInSuggest chips, breaking down the cases where the intent could not be created or started.
Recorded every time the user interacts with the ActionInSuggest, for the Action that the user interacted with. Not recorded if the user does not interact with ActionInSuggest.

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.InputToNavigationControllerStart
histogram.summary: Records time between the user input that triggered an Omnibox navigation on Android to the time the Omnibox code calls into the shared C++ navigation code (NavigationController).

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.InvalidMatch
histogram.summary:
Recorded every time AutocompleteController.java interacts with autocomplete_controller_android.cc. Indicates how often matches referenced by Java are different from the matches referenced by C++ at any position.
Note: starting Chrome 118, this is recorded every time we detect a non-cached match, when Native and Java AutocompleteResult objects differ.

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.JumpStartState
histogram.summary: Records the JumpStart feature eligibility and user preference state during cold start. Logged once per cold start.

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.OmniboxAction.Used
histogram.summary:
Tracks the usage of Omnibox actions displayed in the Omnibox when the user completed interaction with the Omnibox, if at least one action was shown to the user at that time.
Value "Used" indicates that at least one OmniboxAction was shown to the user and it was used. Conversely, value "Not Used" signifies that although actions were displayed, none were employed.
The histogram is not recorded if no actions were visible.
The histogram is recorded once per Omnibox interaction, where at least one Omnibox Action was shown to the user at the time the user completed interaction with the Omnibox.

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.OmniboxAction.Valid
histogram.summary:
Tracks the validity of Omnibox actions displayed in the Omnibox when the user completed interaction with the Omnibox, if at least one action was shown to the user at that time.
Omnibox Actions can appear at any point, but the histogram only captures the ultimate state, disregarding any preceding events.
An OmniboxAction is "Valid" if both Java and Native objects exist and are linked. "Not Valid" indicates a broken relationship, often due to Native AutocompleteResult becoming invalid.
The histogram should ideally show values close to 100% validity.
The histogram captures one value for every Omnibox Action displayed in the Suggestions list when the user completes the interaction with the Omnibox.

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.RefineActionUsage
histogram.summary:
Records interactions with the Search Refine button, differentiating by context (zero-prefix vs non-zero-prefix), including the cases where the User did not interact with the Refine button placed beside the Search suggestion at all.
Recorded once per interaction with the Omnibox and Sugestions, when the Omnibox loses focus. This includes cases where the User chooses to navigate somewhere (both by using a suggestion or pressing Go button on keyboard), or abandons the Omnibox.

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.SearchActivity.ActivityPresent
histogram.summary:
Records whether intent is updating an already present activity. For the most part the expected value here is 'false', indicating that the intent was starting a new session. A value of 'true' indicates that the SearchActivity was already focused and running when a new intent was received. Such intent would need to be emitted while SearchActivity is in foreground.
Recorded once per intent.

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.SearchActivity.IntentOrigin
histogram.summary: Record the origin of an intent (i.e. from where the SearchActivity was called). Recorded once per intent.

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.SearchActivity.LaunchedWithQuery
histogram.summary: Records whether intent used to launch / update SearchActivity carried an (optional) User Query. Recorded once per intent.

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.SearchActivity.NavigationTargetType{IntentOrigin}
histogram.summary:
Records the intended navigation search target type for every navigation initiated from the SearchActivity.
Captures the {IntentOrigin} specific SearchActivity metrics. Recorded exactly once per user initiated navigation. Not recorded if the user abandons SearchActivity.

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.SearchActivity.ReferrerValid
histogram.summary: Records whether Intent Referrer field was valid for Searches initiated from SearchActivity. Recorded only when IntentOrigin is "Custom Tab". Recorded once per SearchActivity session.

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.SearchActivity.RequestedSearchType
histogram.summary: Record the Search type requested from an Intent. Recorded once per intent.

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.SearchActivity.SessionTerminationReason{IntentOrigin}
histogram.summary:
Records the reason SearchActivity was closed.
Captures the {IntentOrigin} specific SearchActivity metrics. Recorded exactly once per SearchActivity session.

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.SetGeolocationHeadersTime
histogram.summary:
Records time spent setting geolocation headers when the user navigates via the Omnibox. This time blocks the start of the navigation and is included in InputToNavigationStart metrics, but not in NavigationTo* metrics.
NOTE: there's a possible gap in data between 2024-04-28 and 2024-08-16.

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.SuggestionList.FocusToImeAnimationStart
histogram.summary:
Records the wall time elapsed between focusing the omnibox and invocation of the onPrepare method signalling the start of an IME (soft keyboard) animation.
Recorded once per omnibox focus on devices when suggestion list animation is enabled, which requires API level 30+ and "controllable" IME insets (which excludes, e.g. most devices with a hardware keyboard attached). This metric is recorded even if the animation is cancelled due to timeout, but is not recorded if the onPrepare method is never called.

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.SuggestionList.LayoutTime2
histogram.summary:
Records thread time spent on positioning all suggestions on screen. This histogram is recorded every time a new suggestion list is received.
Smaller values are indicative of better performance, but the time taken varies considerably based on, e.g. whether new views need to be inflated and the number of suggestions being rendered.
This metric is reported for all users and uses 100microsecond granularity.
When comparing Durations measured here, also compare Total Counts for a correct indication of how frequently views are laid out and how the overall time spent performing layout operation changed.
This histogram is related to Android.Omnibox.SuggestionView.Reused, Android.Omnibox.SuggestionList.MeasureTime2, Android.Omnibox.SuggestionView.CreateTime2.

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.SuggestionList.LayoutTime3
histogram.summary:
Replacement for Android.Omnibox.SuggestionList.LayoutTime2 that uses wall time instead of thread time. Records wall time spent positioning suggestion view onto the screen. This histogram is recorded every time a new suggestion list is received, which is typically multiple times per keystroke.
This metric is reported for all users and uses 1ms granularity.
When comparing durations measured here, also compare Total Counts for a correct indication of how frequently views are laid out and how the overall time spent performing layout operation changed.
This histogram is related to Android.Omnibox.SuggestionList.LayoutTime2, Android.Omnibox.SuggestionView.CreateTime3, and Android.Omnibox.SuggestionList.MeasureTime3

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.SuggestionList.MeasureTime2
histogram.summary:
Records time spent on measuring all suggestions ahead of positioning them on screen. This histogram is recorded every time a new suggestion list is received.
Values recorded here should generally aim to be small, likely below 2ms range. Higher values are an indicator of a performance problem.
Measure operation should take place just once when suggestion view is shown for the first time.
This metric is reported for all users and uses 100microsecond granularity.
When comparing Durations measured here, also compare Total Counts for a correct indication of how frequently views are measured and how the overall time spent measuring views changed.
This histogram is related to Android.Omnibox.SuggestionView.Reused, Android.Omnibox.SuggestionList.LayoutTime2, Android.Omnibox.SuggestionView.CreateTime2.

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.SuggestionList.MeasureTime3
histogram.summary:
Replacement for Android.Omnibox.SuggestionList.MeasureTime2 that uses wall time instead of thread time. Records wall time spent on measuring all suggestions ahead of positioning them on screen. This histogram is recorded every time a new suggestion list is received, which is typically multiple times per keystroke.
This metric is reported for all users and uses 1ms granularity.
When comparing durations measured here, also compare Total Counts for a correct indication of how frequently views are laid out and how the overall time spent performing layout operation changed.
This histogram is related to Android.Omnibox.SuggestionList.MeasureTime2, Android.Omnibox.SuggestionView.CreateTime3, and Android.Omnibox.SuggestionList.LayoutTime3

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.SuggestionList.RequestToUiModel.First
histogram.summary:
Records time elapsed between requesting the suggestions and converting the first (synchronous) set of received suggestions to the UI model.
For the complete, asynchronous iteration see the Android.Omnibox.SuggestionList.RequestToUiModel.Last metric.
This metric is recorded exactly once per request, including the zero-prefix suggestions request.

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.SuggestionList.RequestToUiModel.Last
histogram.summary:
Records time elapsed between requesting the suggestions and converting the final (asynchronous) set of received suggestions to the UI model.
For the short, synchronous iteration see the Android.Omnibox.SuggestionList.RequestToUiModel.First metric.
This metric is recorded at most once per request, including the zero-prefix suggestions request. The metric will not be emitted if the current Autocomplete cycle was canceled by the user - either by refining the input in the omnibox, or by ending the interaction with the Omnibox.

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.SuggestionsListScrolled.{PageClass}
histogram.summary:
For every interaction with the Omnibox, this metric records whether the user scrolled the omnibox while exploring suggestions on {PageClass}.
This is recorded once per Omnibox interaction, regardless of whether the User chooses to navigate somewhere or abandons the interaction.

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.SuggestionView.CreatedType
histogram.summary:
Records the type of suggestion that was reused with the help of RecyclerView.
This histogram drives OmniboxSuggestionsDropdown optimization, helping us find the balance between the volume of suggestions and amount of memory we delegate to re-use the pre-constructed suggestion views.
Along with the Android.Omnibox.SuggestionView.ReusedType, the two histograms paint the picture of which suggestions need to be created more often than others vs which suggestions have more capacity than is actually needed. Higher reuse means lower latency at the expense of slight increase of memory consumption.
This histogram is related to Android.Omnibox.SuggestionView.ReusedType.

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.SuggestionView.CreateTime2
histogram.summary:
Records time spent creating a single suggestion.
Values recorded here should generally aim to be small, below 1ms range. Higher values may be an indicator of a performance problem.
This metric is reported for all users and uses 100microsecond granularity.
When comparing Durations measured here, also compare Total Counts for a correct indication of how frequently views are created and how the overall time spent creating views changed.
This histogram is related to Android.Omnibox.SuggestionList.LayoutTime2, Android.Omnibox.SuggestionList.MeasureTime2, Android.Omnibox.SuggestionView.Reused.

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.SuggestionView.CreateTime3
histogram.summary:
Replacement for Android.Omnibox.SuggestionList.CreateTime2 that uses wall time instead of thread time. Records wall time spent on creating a single suggestion view. This histogram is recorded every time a new view is created, but not when a view is recycled.
This metric is reported for all users and uses 1ms granularity.
When comparing Durations measured here, also compare Total Counts for a correct indication of how frequently views are created and how the overall time spent creating views changed.
This histogram is related to Android.Omnibox.SuggestionView.CreateTime2, Android.Omnibox.SuggestionList.LayoutTime3, and Android.Omnibox.SuggestionList.MeasureTime3

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.SuggestionView.ReusedType
histogram.summary:
Records the type of suggestion that was reused with the help of RecyclerView.
This histogram drives OmniboxSuggestionsDropdown optimization, helping us find the balance between the volume of suggestions and amount of memory we delegate to re-use the pre-constructed suggestion views.
Along with the Android.Omnibox.SuggestionView.CreatedType, the two histograms paint the picture of which suggestions need to be created more often than others vs which suggestions have more capacity than is actually needed. Higher reuse means lower latency at the expense of slight increase of memory consumption.
This histogram is related to Android.Omnibox.SuggestionView.CreatedType.

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.SuggestionView.SessionViewsCreated
histogram.summary:
Records number of views created from the moment the Omnibox was focused, until the interaction was completed, whether the user navigated somewhere or canceled the interaction.
Values recorded here tell how efficiently the view creation and re-use works, highlighting possible issues related to unusually frequent view creation; the number of views created should be low and not exceed the sum of all the views recycled by HistogramRecordingRecycledViewPool component. Any deviation from this are a signal that the RecycledViewPool limits are not optimal.
When observing a higher than expected number of created views, consult the Android.Omnibox.SuggestionView.CreatedType to identify view type that is not correctly captured and update the limits of the HistogramRecordingRecycledViewPool.
This histogram is related to Android.Omnibox.SuggestionView.CreatedType, Android.Omnibox.SuggestionView.SessionViewsReused.

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.SuggestionView.SessionViewsReused
histogram.summary:
Captures the efficiency of the view re-use from the moment the Omnibox was focused, until the interaction was completed, whether the user navigated somewhere or canceled the interaction.
Values captured here directly reflect the efficiency of recycled view pool tuning, with the following caveats:
* short sessions (omnibox focused and defocused, with no inputs) will report efficiency of 0% (because all the views had to be created and no views were available for re-use).
* this metric will never truly capture 100% effectiveness, because during every input session some views will have to be created.
The captured value should be at or above 90% re-use. Lower re-use rates may be an indication of a possible issue.
This histogram is related to Android.Omnibox.SuggestionView.SessionViewsCreated.

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.UsedSuggestionFromCache
histogram.summary:
Records whether users interacted with suggestion originating from Java cache.
Android presents the Cached suggestions for a brief time before the Native libraries become available, replacing these with a fresh content as soon as Autocomplete subsystem serves them. This histogram records all the events where the cached suggestions were shown for an extended period of time - long enough for the User to identify and interact with a suggestion of their choice.
Recorded every time the User initiates navigation using the Omnibox or the Suggestions list, regardless of context.
Note: starting Chrome 118 this is recorded for every Autocomplete action requiring native AutocompleteMatch instance.

histogram.name: Android.Omnibox.{AndroidSearchPrefetch}.GeoLocationHeaderTime.{AndroidNavigationOrSuggestionPrefetch}
Android.Omnibox.{AndroidSearchPrefetch}.NumPrefetchesStartedInOmniboxSession.{AndroidNavigationPrefetchOnly}
Android.Omnibox.{AndroidSearchPrefetch}.TouchDownPrefetchResult.{AndroidNavigationPrefetchOnly}
Android.Omnibox.{AndroidSearchPrefetch}.TouchDownProcessTime.{AndroidNavigationPrefetchOnly}
Android.OmniboxFocusReason
histogram.summary: Records how the omnibox was focused.

histogram.name: Android.OverscrollFromBottom.BottomControlsStatus
histogram.summary: Records when user starts a overscroll from the bottom on a tab, the status of the bottom browser controls. This only records when the content is scrollable, and the scroll starts from the bottom of the content page.

histogram.name: Android.OverscrollFromBottom.CanStart
histogram.summary: Records, when user starts a overscroll from the bottom on a tab, whether the overscroll satisfied the start condition (e.g. the browser controls is not already shown).

histogram.name: Android.OverscrollFromBottom.DidTriggerOverscroll
histogram.summary: Records, when user starts a overscroll from the bottom on a tab, whether the overscroll handler fired the callback to re-show the browser controls.

histogram.name: Android.PackageStats.CacheSize
histogram.summary: Records the size of the user's cache at startup on Android O and above.

histogram.name: Android.PackageStats.CodeSize
histogram.summary: At startup, records the space on disk taken by Chrome application including APK resources, compiled libraries, and extracted native code. Only recorded for Android O and above.

histogram.name: Android.PackageStats.DataSize
histogram.summary: Records the size of the user's data directory at startup on Android O and above. Does not include cache size.

histogram.name: Android.PageContentProtoViewStructureBuilder.Result
histogram.summary: Records whether the PageContentProtoViewStructureBuilder was successful in getting the page content proto and populating the virtual structure. Recorded when onProvideVirtualStructure is called on ContentView when the AnnotatedPageContentsVirtualStructure feature is enabled.

histogram.name: Android.PartnerCustomization.HomepageCustomizationOutcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of initial Tab creation relative to Homepage customization. The outcome characterizes the initial Tab focusing on an NTP and whether it was created correctly. When a custom Homepage was created we only record whether it was a Partner Homepage or some other Homepage. At this time we don't differentiate between User and Policy Homepages or record whether any Homepage was correctly created when customization changes. Recorded at the end of customization or initial Tab creation, whichever is last.

histogram.name: Android.PartnerCustomization.HomepageCustomizationOutcome.{CustomizationDelegate}
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of initial Tab creation relative to Homepage customization using delegate "{CustomizationDelegate}". The outcome characterizes the initial Tab focusing on an NTP and whether it was created correctly. When a custom Homepage was created we only record whether it was a Partner Homepage or some other Homepage. At this time we don't differentiate between User and Policy Homepages or record whether any Homepage was correctly created when customization changes. Recorded at the end of customization or initial Tab creation, whichever is last.

histogram.name: Android.PartnerCustomization.HomepageCustomizationOutcomeNotCached.{CustomizationDelegate}
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of initial Tab creation relative to Homepage customization using delegate "{CustomizationDelegate}" when the Homepage was not previously cached. The outcome characterizes the initial Tab focusing on an NTP and whether it was created correctly. When a custom Homepage was created we only record whether it was a Partner Homepage or some other Homepage. At this time we don't differentiate between User and Policy Homepages or record whether any Homepage was correctly created when customization changes. Recorded at the end of customization or initial Tab creation, whichever is last.

histogram.name: Android.PartnerCustomization.TaskCompletion
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of the async initialization task for the partner browser customization. This tells us how often the delegate is able to provide correct data, is canceled due to timeout, and whether exceptions were thrown, etc. Note that the correct data may actually arrive too late to be used because Chrome waits only 1/2 second before creating an initial tab, but it will be recorded here regardless. This logging of Completed-too-late is only done by the Chrome App, but all other values are logged for CCT as well. Recorded when the async task is completed or canceled during Chrome's start up.

histogram.name: Android.PartnerCustomization.TaskCompletion.{CustomizationDelegate}
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of the async initialization task for the partner browser customization. This tells us how often the delegate "{CustomizationDelegate}" is able to provide correct data, is canceled due to timeout, and whether exceptions were thrown, for this delegate. Note that the correct data may actually arrive too late to be used because Chrome waits only 1/2 second before creating an initial tab, but it will be recorded here regardless. This logging of Completed-too-late is only done by the Chrome App, but all other values are logged for CCT as well. Recorded when the async task is completed or canceled during Chrome's start up.

histogram.name: Android.PartnerCustomization.TaskCompletionNotCached.{CustomizationDelegate}
histogram.summary: Warning, this histogram may have a data gap since it was expired on 2023-12-12 and reenabled around 2024-03-01. Records the outcome of the async initialization task for the partner browser customization, when there is not yet any cached Homepage (likely Chrome's first launch). This tells us how often the delegate "{CustomizationDelegate}" is able to provide correct data, is canceled due to timeout, and whether exceptions were thrown, for this delegate. Note that the correct data may actually arrive too late to be used because Chrome waits only 1/2 second before creating an initial tab, but it will be recorded here regardless. This logging of Completed-too-late is only done by the Chrome App, but all other values are logged for CCT as well. Recorded when the async task is completed or canceled during Chrome's start up when no homepage is already cached.

histogram.name: Android.PartnerCustomization.TryFailedDuration.{CustomizationDelegate}
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time it took for the delegate "{CustomizationDelegate}" to run in the async task that does partner customization. Recorded when the task completes but was unable to use the delegate for some reason. Trying to use the PreloadApk delegate is only done when actually needed so these numbers should reflect actual usage attempts.

histogram.name: Android.PartnerCustomization.TrySucceededDuration.{CustomizationDelegate}
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time it took for the delegate "{CustomizationDelegate}" to run in the async task that does partner customization. Recorded when the task completes successfully and a delegate providing customizations is found. Trying to use the PreloadApk delegate is only done when actually needed so these numbers should reflect actual usage attempts.

histogram.name: Android.PartnerCustomization.Usage
histogram.summary: Records which customization usage is being invoked, at the time it is requested. The possible usages include a custom Homepage URL, suppressing incognito, etc.

histogram.name: Android.PartnerHomepageCustomization.Delegate2
histogram.summary: Records which delegate will be used to provide the home page URL that is needed for a custom provider's customization. Recorded at startup on Android.

histogram.name: Android.PasswordEcho.SettingReadTime.{SettingType}
histogram.summary:
Records the time taken to read the password echo setting(s) from the system server during initialization. The {SettingType} token specifies the type of setting read.
Only emitted once when the embedding application's instance of PasswordEchoSettingState is created. The metric recorded (either the split or the legacy setting) depends on the state of the Aconfig feature flag for splitting the password echo settings.
This is recorded only on Android, where the timer is always high-resolution.

histogram.name: Android.PasswordEcho.SettingStateInitializationTime
histogram.summary:
Records the total time taken for the PasswordEchoSettingState class to complete its initialization. This time includes operations like reading the Aconfig feature flag state, registering the necessary ContentObserver(s) for monitoring setting changes, and the initial read of the relevant system setting value(s).
Only emitted once when the embedding application's instance of PasswordEchoSettingState is created.
This is recorded only on Android, where the timer is always high-resolution.

histogram.name: Android.Pdf.AssistContent.GetAssistantPackageResult
histogram.summary: Records whether we were able to get the package name of the default assistant app from Android's settings. Recorded when AssistContent is requested for pdf pages.

histogram.name: Android.Pdf.AssistContent.IsEnterpriseInfoCached
histogram.summary: Records whether the device enterprise info has been cached when getting it synchronously for pdf pages.

histogram.name: Android.Pdf.AssistContent.IsWorkProfile
histogram.summary: Records whether we are running in a work profile. Recorded when AssistContent is generated successfully for pdf pages. Used to determine the frequency of AssistContent preparation on pdf pages; and how often the work profile is on while preparing AssistContent for pdf pages.

histogram.name: Android.Pdf.DocumentLoad
histogram.summary: Recorded when the pdf load starts. Used to compare against Android.Pdf.DocumentLoadResult.Detail, which is recorded when the pdf load is complete, to determine how many pdf loads are not complete.

histogram.name: Android.Pdf.DocumentLoadInterval
histogram.summary: Records the elapsed time between two pdf document loads. Recorded when the pdf load starts. Used to evaluate the threshold to keep PdfDocumentService running after the last client unbinds.

histogram.name: Android.Pdf.DocumentLoadResult.Detail
histogram.summary: Records the pdf document load result details. Recorded when the pdf load is completed or aborted. Only record when there is a paired Android.Pdf.DocumentLoad. Only record the first load result for each pdf load.

histogram.name: Android.Pdf.DocumentLoadTime.FirstPaired
histogram.summary: Records the pdf document load time. Recorded when the pdf load is complete. Records the first successful load for each explicit pdf load. Only record when there is a paired Android.Pdf.DocumentLoad.

histogram.name: Android.Pdf.DownloadTime.Transient
histogram.summary: Records the pdf download time for transient downloads, i.e. download pdf to open in Chrome. Recorded when the pdf download is complete and before pdf view is rendered. Used to assess the prioritization of a refined user experience for downloading.

histogram.name: Android.Pdf.DownloadUrlDecoded
histogram.summary: Records whether the pdf download url is successfully decoded. This is recorded when re-download is needed for pdf pages (e.g. Chrome restart or navigate back/forward).

histogram.name: Android.Pdf.DownloadUrlEncoded
histogram.summary: Records whether the pdf download url is successfully encoded. This is recorded when the pdf download starts.

histogram.name: Android.Pdf.FindInPageCounts
histogram.summary: Records find-in-page invocation counts for each pdf page. The count number represents the previous find-in-page invocations on the same pdf page. This can be recorded more than once for each pdf page. Recorded when find-in-page is invoked.

histogram.name: Android.Pdf.IsFrozenWhenDisplayed
histogram.summary: Records whether the pdf native page is frozen before the tab is displayed, such as being selected from tab switcher or tab strip. Used to determine how often the pdf native page is frozen.

histogram.name: Android.PhotoPicker.BitmapScalerTask
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time the BitmapScaler spent scaling a bitmap. Note: This metric was not logged in June 2023.

histogram.name: Android.PhotoPicker.CacheHits
histogram.summary: Measures the total number of images served from the high-res cache during the lifetime of the dialog. Note: This metric was not logged in June 2023.

histogram.name: Android.PhotoPicker.DecodeRequests
histogram.summary: Measures the total number of images sent for decoding during the lifetime of the dialog. Note: This metric was not logged in June 2023.

histogram.name: Android.PhotoPicker.DecoderHostFailureOutOfMemory
histogram.summary: The percentage of out-of-memory decoding failures, per batch of photos (not videos) decoded. Intended to help identify if there are devices where decoding fails 100% of the time. Be wary at looking at other numbers in the histogram, as a value emitted at, say, 50% may represent one failure in a two-item decoding or 50 failures in a hundred-item decoding. These are qualitatively different experiences for a user. Note: This metric was not logged in June 2023.

histogram.name: Android.PhotoPicker.DecoderHostVideoFileError
histogram.summary: The percentage of file error decoding failures, per batch of videos (not photos) decoded. Intended to help identify if there are devices where decoding fails 100% of the time. Be wary at looking at other numbers in the histogram, as a value emitted at, say, 50% may represent one failure in a two-item decoding or 50 failures in a hundred-item decoding. These are qualitatively different experiences for a user. Note: This metric was not logged in June 2023.

histogram.name: Android.PhotoPicker.DecoderHostVideoIoError
histogram.summary: The percentage of IO error decoding failures, per batch of videos (not photos) decoded. Intended to help identify if there are devices where decoding fails 100% of the time. Be wary at looking at other numbers in the histogram, as a value emitted at, say, 50% may represent one failure in a two-item decoding or 50 failures in a hundred-item decoding. These are qualitatively different experiences for a user. Note: This metric was not logged in June 2023.

histogram.name: Android.PhotoPicker.DecoderHostVideoRuntimeError
histogram.summary: The percentage of runtime error decoding failures, per batch of videos (not photos) decoded. Intended to help identify if there are devices where decoding fails 100% of the time. Be wary at looking at other numbers in the histogram, as a value emitted at, say, 50% may represent one failure in a two-item decoding or 50 failures in a hundred-item decoding. These are qualitatively different experiences for a user. Note: This metric was not logged in June 2023.

histogram.name: Android.PhotoPicker.DecoderHostVideoUnknownError
histogram.summary: The percentage of unknown decoding error failures, per batch of videos (not photos) decoded. Intended to help identify if there are devices where decoding fails 100% of the time. Be wary at looking at other numbers in the histogram, as a value emitted at, say, 50% may represent one failure in a two-item decoding or 50 failures in a hundred-item decoding. These are qualitatively different experiences for a user. Note: This metric was not logged in June 2023.

histogram.name: Android.PhotoPicker.DialogAction
histogram.summary: Records which action the user takes in the PhotoPickerDialog.

histogram.name: Android.PhotoPicker.EnumeratedFiles
histogram.summary: Measures the total number of files returned from the enumeration operation. Measured once at the end of the enumeration operation. Note: This metric was not logged in June 2023.

histogram.name: Android.PhotoPicker.EnumeratedRate
histogram.summary: Measures the enumeration rate (files per tenths of a second). Measured once at the end of the enumeration operation. Note: This metric was not logged in June 2023.

histogram.name: Android.PhotoPicker.EnumerationTime
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time the BitmapScaler spent enumerating files on disk. Measured once at the end of the enumeration operation. Note: This metric was not logged in June 2023.

histogram.name: Android.PhotoPicker.ExifOrientation
histogram.summary: Records whether the EXIF orientation directive is present and what it is set to. Collected once per decoded image, but only on Android N and above (and when no IO error occurs). Note: This metric was not logged in June 2023.

histogram.name: Android.PhotoPicker.ImageByteCount
histogram.summary: Measures the byte count of a decoded image. Only recorded on successful decodes. Note: This metric was not logged in June 2023.

histogram.name: Android.PhotoPicker.ImageDecodeTime
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time it takes the decoder to decode one image. Only recorded on successful decodes. Note: This metric was not logged in June 2023.

histogram.name: Android.PhotoPicker.RequestProcessTime
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time it takes to process one image decode request (not video) end to end (RPC and actual decoding of the bits by utility process). Recorded whether or not the RPC/decode request was successful. Note: This metric was not logged in June 2023.

histogram.name: Android.PhotoPicker.RequestProcessTimeAnimation
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time it takes to decode all the frames needed to show the animation -- end to end (RPC and actual decoding of the bits by utility process). Recorded whether or not the RPC/decode request was successful. Note: This metric was not logged in June 2023.

histogram.name: Android.PhotoPicker.RequestProcessTimeThumbnail
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time it takes to process one video frame request end to end (RPC and actual decoding of the bits by utility process). Recorded whether or not the RPC/decode request was successful. Note: This metric was not logged in June 2023.

histogram.name: Android.PhotoPicker.UpscaleLowResBitmap
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time it takes to upscale a bitmap from the low-res cache. Recorded only when there a cache miss from the high-res bitmap but a cache hit from the low-res (placeholder) bitmap. Note: This metric was not logged in June 2023.

histogram.name: Android.PhotoPicker.VideoByteCount
histogram.summary: Measures the byte count of the first video thumbnail. Only recorded on successful decodes. Note: This metric was not logged in June 2023.

histogram.name: Android.PhotoPicker.VideoDecodeTimeAnimation
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time it takes the decoder to decode all the frames needed to display an animated thumbnail. Only recorded on successful decodes. Note: This metric was not logged in June 2023.

histogram.name: Android.PhotoPicker.VideoDecodeTimeThumbnail
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time it takes the decoder to decode the first frame of a video. Only recorded on successful decodes. Note: This metric was not logged in June 2023.

histogram.name: Android.PlayServices.ShortVersion
histogram.summary: The short version code for Google Play Services in a format YYWWV, where YY is year, WW is week and V is version (0 for beta releases and 1 for stable release). This metric is logged with every UMA upload. 0 is recorded when GMS Core is not installed, 1 when GMS Core version can't be parsed and 2 when GMS Core version doesn't fit into defined range.

histogram.name: Android.PlayServices.Version
histogram.summary: The version code for Google Play Services if it is installed on the device, or 0 if it is not. Recorded during deferred startup.

histogram.name: Android.PredictiveGestureNavigation{Transition}
histogram.summary: Record the phase when a gesture nav is triggered {Transition} by user's gesture and when the predictive back gesture is on.

variant.summary: no matter if a transition is activated

histogram.name: Android.PredictiveNavigationTransition.CaptureNativeViewResult
histogram.summary: Record the result of capturing a screenshot of a native page view. This screenshot will be saved for back forward transition and used a preview when user navigating back to native page. Record when user navigates away from a native view page.

histogram.name: Android.PredictiveNavigationTransition.NavigateBetweenNativePages
histogram.summary: Record whether a navigation is about to start from a chrome native page to another chrome native page. Record right before such navigation starts.

histogram.name: Android.PredictiveNavigationTransition.NTPFeedRestorationDuration
histogram.summary: Record the duration when the feed stream is restored after being transited to New Tab Page.

histogram.name: Android.PredictiveNavigationTransition.NTPSmoothTransitionByFallback
histogram.summary: Record whether animation is triggered because of the timeout fallback. False if it's triggered right after the feed stream is restored.

histogram.name: Android.PrepareMenu.OpenWebApkVisibilityCheck
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time spent querying for whether a WebAPK is already installed.

histogram.name: Android.ReaderModeCpa.Shown
histogram.summary: Tells whether Reader Mode CPA button can be shown i.e. has the space in the toolbar. Recorded when Contextual page action controller chooses Reader Mode for the action to display as CPA.

histogram.name: Android.Reparent.TabGroup.Duration
histogram.summary: The duration captured the time between A) before setup reparenting intent and tabs being detached and B) target activity processes the intent and is brought to the foreground.

histogram.name: Android.Reparent.TabGroup.GroupSize
histogram.summary: Record the number of tabs in the group being reparented to another window.

histogram.name: Android.Reparent.TabGroup.GroupSize.Diff
histogram.summary: Record the change in the number of tabs in the reparented group before and after the reparenting operation. Should be 0 if all the tabs in the tab group is successfully reparented.

histogram.name: Android.RequestDesktopSite.Changed
histogram.summary: Records the changes of request desktop site content settings. This is recorded when a user manually switches the global setting between mobile/desktop.

histogram.name: Android.RequestDesktopSite.DomainSettingChanged
histogram.summary: Records the new domain level Request Desktop Setting when changed. False means Mobile site while true means Desktop site. This is recorded when a user manually edits a domain level Request Desktop Setting from the site settings exception list.

histogram.name: Android.RequestDesktopSite.SubDomainSettingChanged
histogram.summary: Records the new subdomain level Request Desktop Setting when changed. False means Mobile site while true means Desktop site. This is recorded when a user manually edits a subdomain level Request Desktop Setting from the site settings exception list.

histogram.name: Android.RequestDesktopSite.UseDesktopUserAgent
histogram.summary: Records if Chrome uses the desktop site user agent to request websites. This is recorded when each tab loads a new url or reloads a url.

histogram.name: Android.RequestDesktopSite.UserSwitchToDesktop
histogram.summary: Records if a user switched to request desktop site from the app menu. This is recorded when a user manually switches sites between the desktop/mobile.

histogram.name: Android.RequestDesktopSite.UserSwitchToDesktop.DomainSettingAdded
histogram.summary: Records the new domain level Request Desktop Setting when added. False means Mobile site while true means Desktop site. This is recorded when a user manually adds a domain level Request Desktop Setting from the Add site dialog in Site settings.

histogram.name: Android.RequestDesktopSite.UserSwitchToDesktop.SubDomainSettingAdded
histogram.summary: Records the new subdomain level Request Desktop Setting when added. False means Mobile site while true means Desktop site. This is recorded when a user manually adds a subdomain level Request Desktop Setting from the Add site dialog in Site settings.

histogram.name: Android.RequestDesktopSite.WindowSettingChanged
histogram.summary: Records the new Request Desktop window setting when changed. If the setting is true, Chrome will request mobile view when the window is narrow. This is recorded when a user manually changes the Request Desktop window setting from the site settings.

histogram.name: Android.RestoreResult
histogram.summary: Whether Chrome tried to restore its settings from a previous device or installation, and what happened when it did. Only recorded on first run.

histogram.name: Android.RestoreTabsOnFRE.DeviceRestoredFrom
histogram.summary: Whether the user restored tabs from the non default selected device. Recorded only if the user has multiple synced devices, and once per user interaction with the entire workflow on restore.

histogram.name: Android.RestoreTabsOnFRE.EligibleTabsForRestoreCount
histogram.summary: The total count of tabs eligible to be restored from the selected device. Recorded once per user attempt to restore tabs from the selected device.

histogram.name: Android.RestoreTabsOnFRE.PromoShowResult2
histogram.summary: The outcome of the promo show attempt from the RestoreTabsFeatureHelper. Recorded once per user attempt to show the promo after first run experience.

histogram.name: Android.RestoreTabsOnFRE.RestoredTabsResult
histogram.summary: The portion of tabs the user ended up restoring out of the maximum possible amount. Recorded once per user attempt to restore tabs from the selected device.

histogram.name: Android.RestoreTabsOnFRE.ResultActionFirstShow2
histogram.summary: The result of the workflow action taken on the RestoreTabs promo. Recorded once per user interaction with the promo when shown the first time.

histogram.name: Android.RestoreTabsOnFRE.ResultActionSecondShow2
histogram.summary: The result of the workflow action taken on the RestoreTabs promo. Recorded once per user interaction with the promo when shown the second time.

histogram.name: Android.RestoreTabsOnFRE.SyncedDevicesCount
histogram.summary: The total count of synced devices on the user logged in account. Recorded once per user interaction with the entire workflow.

histogram.name: Android.RestoreTabsOnFRE.TabsRestoredCount
histogram.summary: The total count of tabs that were actually restored from the selected device. Recorded once per user attempt to restore tabs from the selected device.

histogram.name: Android.RestoreTabsOnFRE.TabsRestoredPercentage
histogram.summary: The ratio between the number of tabs that the user is eligible to restore and the number of tabs that were actually restored, from the currently selected device calculated as a percentage. Recorded once per user attempt to restore tabs from the selected device.

histogram.name: Android.Scrim.MissingParent.Client
histogram.summary: Scrims are placed into the view heirarchy by walking up from the anchor view looking for the parent. This is supposed to always work, but we're currently seeing failures in the wild. This histogram aims to narrow down which scrim clients are having problems to inform the investigation.

histogram.name: Android.Scrim.ShowRequest.Client
histogram.summary: Emitted when a scrim is actaully triggered. Should help narrow down which clients that have code depedencies on the scrim systme actaully use it. It's possible some are legacy and just dead code. Additionally, will help give a ratio of usages to problems encountered when compared to the other scrim histograms.

histogram.name: Android.SearchEngineChoice.ChosenSearchEngine
histogram.summary: The type of the search engine chosen by the user in Search Engine Choice flow.

histogram.name: Android.SearchEngineChoice.Events
histogram.summary: Counts occurences of various events related to Search Engine Choice feature.

histogram.name: Android.SearchEngineChoice.EventsV2
histogram.summary: Counts occurences of various events related to Search Engine Choice V2 feature.

histogram.name: Android.SearchEngineChoice.SearchEngineBeforeChoicePrompt
histogram.summary: The type of the search engine used before Search Engine Choice flow was presented.

histogram.name: Android.SeccompStatus.RendererSandbox
histogram.summary: Reports the status of the seccomp-bpf sandbox in renderer processes. Anything other than "Sandbox Engaged" indicates the sandbox is not turned on. See https://crbug.com/477049.

histogram.name: Android.SelectFileDialogContentSelected
histogram.summary: Records the types of content selected for upload, focusing mostly on image and video types and how they were determined (asking ContentResolver for the MIME type or going by extension). Recorded when user uploads files to a website (once per item uploaded).

histogram.name: Android.SelectFileDialogImgCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of images selected in either the new Photo Picker or the standard Android file picker. Note: Only recorded in situations determined to warrant the new Photo Picker (not, for example, if mixed content, like images and text files, was requested).

histogram.name: Android.SelectFileDialogScope
histogram.summary: Records the scope of accepted content for a select file dialog when shown by a Web developer.

histogram.name: Android.SelectFileDialogUploadMethods
histogram.summary: Records the method of upload for files uploaded from Chrome via the SelectFileDialog, focusing mostly on image and video types. Recorded when user uploads files to a website (once per item uploaded).

histogram.name: Android.ServiceTracingProxyProvider.SuccessesOutOfInitialForty
histogram.summary:
When the number of attempts to proxy Binder services reaches 40, records the number of successful proxy installations.
Recorded only on channels: Dev, Canary, Beta.

histogram.name: Android.Settings.PendingPopBackWorked
histogram.summary: Records when the user triggers fragment pop back on SettingsActivity after the fragment manager already saved its state. In the case we delayed the pop back operation. Records the number of such cases to make sure this works enough. This record is used to verify the effectiveness of the fix.

histogram.name: Android.ShowSelectionMenuSourceType
histogram.summary: Records the menu source type when a selection menu is shown. Android only.

histogram.name: Android.SpareTab.FinalStatus
histogram.summary: Records the final status of the spare tab, for example, if the spare tab is used, destroyed, crashed, etc. This is recorded when the spare tab is used for navigation or destroyed. It is only recorded when a spare tab is created, and it is only recorded once per spare tab.

histogram.name: Android.StorageSystem.Type
histogram.summary: Records the type of storage system on the device. This is determined by inspecting system files. Recorded once on deferred startup.

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.OverrideUrlLoadingTime
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time due to a StrictMode violation from calling out to Android activity manager.

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.ThumbnailCacheDir
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time due to a StrictMode violation from fetching for the thumbnail cache directory.

histogram.name: Android.StyleUtils.FontLoadingOutcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome for loading font using applyTextAppearanceToTextPaint. Recorded during layout initialization on tablets.

histogram.name: Android.Survey.DownloadRequested2
histogram.summary: Recorded when a survey download is requested. If the download has been attemped, but the download request is not sent (e.g. user is not signed-in), 'not requested' will be recorded.

histogram.name: Android.Survey.DownloadResponseCode2
histogram.summary: The result of the completed survey download request. A survey download is initiated on ChromeTabbedActivity cold start iff the user passes a series of eligibility checks. Recorded when a valid survey response is received. Android only.

histogram.name: Android.Survey.ShowSurveyStatus
histogram.summary: The result of the request to show the survey after it has been downloaded. This request is initiated when the user accepts to take the survey on the survey prompt. This histogram is agnostic to the content of the survey, which is configured server side, and will be recorded for all surveys shown in Chrome. Android only.

histogram.name: Android.Survey.SurveyCompleted
histogram.summary: Whether a user completed the survey after it was presented. This histogram is agnostic to the content of the survey, which is configured server side, and will be recorded for all surveys shown in Chrome. Android only.

histogram.name: Android.Survey.SurveyFilteringResults
histogram.summary: The result of the survey filtering process. Each enum represents a different filter that caught the user. This is recorded on cold starts when we check if a user qualifies for a survey.

histogram.name: Android.Sync.ActualSyncedTabCountPercentage
histogram.summary: Records the percentage of sync-eligible tabs that are in local sync storage. This is recorded after session restore is completed and local data is reconciled.

histogram.name: Android.Tab.BackgroundColorChange
histogram.summary: Records a change in the background color of a tab resulting in an update to tab observers. This background color change may be due to a change in web content or web content background, a custom view being set, or a native page being shown or hidden. A sharp increase in such updates may have performance implications - measuring an increase in such updates is particularly helpful for the OSNavBarMatchesTab feature, which has observed some performance regressions.

histogram.name: Android.Tab.BackgroundColorChange.PreOptimization
histogram.summary: Records a potential change in the background color of a tab. This potential change may or may not be communicated to observers, as an optimization will attempt to avoid redundant notifications. To measure the number of notifications that are actually communicated to observers, refer to 'Android.Tab.BackgroundColorChange'.

histogram.name: Android.Tab.CreateNewTabDuration.{TabLaunchType}2
histogram.summary: Records the duration of new tab creation for {TabLaunchType}. Emitted everytime a new tab is finished being created. Take into account that low-end devices create tabs more slowly, so adjust your analysis accordingly.

histogram.name: Android.TabContentManager.CaptureThumbnail.{PageType}.Duration
histogram.summary: This histogram records the time taken to screenshot the contents of a tab to use as a thumbnail. Recorded once per capture.

histogram.name: Android.TabGroupParity.TabGroupColorChangeActionType
histogram.summary: Reports the entrypoint from which a tab group's color icon was changed. Record once per user attempt to change the tab group's color in the TabGridDialog view.

histogram.name: Android.TabGroupParity.TabGroupCreationDialogResultAction
histogram.summary: The result of the action taken from the TabGroupCreation dialog. Record once per user attempt to create a new tab group through the TabGroupCreation modal dialog.

histogram.name: Android.TabGroupParity.TabGroupCreationFinalSelections
histogram.summary: The result of the group color and title selections made when accepting the TabGroupCreation dialog. Record once per user attempt to create a new tab group through the TabGroupCreation modal dialog.

histogram.name: Android.TabGroupSync.WindowStateOnFailedOpen
histogram.summary: When a tab group open from the tab group pane failes because there is no local id, this metric is emitted with the state that the tab is in. This should help narrow down why this is happening.

histogram.name: Android.TabItemPicker.ActiveTabs.Count
histogram.summary: Records the number of 'active' (currently loaded in memory/session) tabs that are eligible for the tab picker. Recorded when the Tab Picker UI is preparing its list of displayable tabs.

histogram.name: Android.TabItemPicker.ActiveTabsPicked.Count
histogram.summary: Records the number of 'active' (live) tabs actually selected by the user, when the user confirms their selection in the Tab Picker.

histogram.name: Android.TabItemPicker.CachedTabs.Count
histogram.summary: Records the number of tabs found in the PageContentExtractionService cache that are eligible for the tab picker. Recorded when the Tab Picker UI is preparing its list of displayable tabs.

histogram.name: Android.TabItemPicker.CachedTabsPicked.Count
histogram.summary: Records the number of 'cached' tabs actually selected by the user, when the user confirms their selection in the Tab Picker.

histogram.name: Android.TabItemPicker.SelectableTabs.Count
histogram.summary: The number of selectable tabs available to the user in the tab item picker. Recorded when the tab picker UI is shown.

histogram.name: Android.TabItemPicker.SelectedTabs.Count
histogram.summary: The number of tabs selected by the user in the tab item picker. Recorded when the user confirms their selection.

histogram.name: Android.TabletDeterminationMismatch
histogram.summary: Records whether the tablet determination logic via resource loading and display properties is different. This is recorded once per activity lifespan during startup (attachBaseContext).

histogram.name: Android.TabMultiSelectV2.BookmarkTabsCount
histogram.summary: Reports the number of tabs that are bookmarked using the TabListEditor bookmark action. Recorded once per user attempt to bookmark tabs in the Tab Selection Editor.

histogram.name: Android.TabMultiSelectV2.SharingState
histogram.summary: The result of the share action taken from the TabListEditor. Record once per user attempt to share tabs in the Tab Selection Editor.

histogram.name: Android.TabMultiSelectV2.TimeSinceLastShown
histogram.summary: Measures the time between opening the TabListEditor in milliseconds within a given browser activity lifespan. This is recorded when the TabListEditor is shown with the exception of the first time it is shown within an activity lifespan.

histogram.name: Android.TabNavigationIntercept.Scheme
histogram.summary: When a navigation is intercepted, the scheme of the URL being intercepted.

histogram.name: Android.TabNavigationInterceptResult.For{ProtocolType}
histogram.summary: The distribution of results when running ExternalNavigationHandler for navigations that have an {ProtocolType}. This shows how often we send intents to be handled by other applications.

histogram.name: Android.TabNavigationInterceptResult.For{Scheme}
histogram.summary: The distribution of results when running ExternalNavigationHandler for {Scheme} navigations which are intercepted. This shows how frequently {Scheme} navigations trigger a dialog (that the user may potentially cancel to cancel the external app launch.)

histogram.name: Android.TabStrip.NullTabHoverCardView.ShowDelayed
histogram.summary:
Emitted when mTabHoverCardView object is unexpectedly null during a StripLayoutHelper.showTabHoverCardView call. The value is True if the showTabHoverCardView call was delayed, and False if it was immediate.
Recorded once per call, if the mLastHoveredTab is not null and mTabHoverCardView is null.

histogram.name: Android.TabStrip.PlaceholderStripLeftoverTabsCount
histogram.summary: We show empty placeholder tabs on the tablet tab strip during startup. The placeholders will be replaced by real tabs once they are restored, preventing a visual flicker/scroll jank as the restored tabs are rapidly populated to the strip. The number of placeholders and positioning of the active tab is calculated based on tab metadata saved to disk, and thus does not account for tabs created by other means during startup (e.g. user interaction). This histogram records the number of placeholder tabs, if any that are leftover when all tabs have been restored. This is captured when all tabs are finished restoring.

histogram.name: Android.TabStrip.PlaceholderStripTabsCreatedDuringRestoreCount
histogram.summary: We show empty placeholder tabs on the tablet tab strip during startup. The placeholders will be replaced by real tabs once they are restored, preventing a visual flicker/scroll jank as the restored tabs are rapidly populated to the strip. The number of placeholders and positioning of the active tab is calculated based on tab metadata saved to disk, and thus does not account for tabs created by other means during startup (e.g. user interaction). This histogram records the number of tabs created in this way (and thus are not accounted for in the placeholder strip). This is captured when all tabs are finished restoring.

histogram.name: Android.TabStrip.PlaceholderStripTabsNeededDuringRestoreCount
histogram.summary: We show empty placeholder tabs on the tablet tab strip during startup. The placeholders will be replaced by real tabs once they are restored, preventing a visual flicker/scroll jank as the restored tabs are rapidly populated to the strip. The number of placeholders and positioning of the active tab is calculated based on tab metadata saved to disk, and thus does not account for tabs created by other means during startup (e.g. user interaction). This histogram records the number of restored tabs, if any, that we unexpectedly did not allocate a placeholder for. This is captured when all tabs are finished restoring.

histogram.name: Android.TabStrip.PlaceholderStripVisibleDuration
histogram.summary: We show empty placeholder tabs on the tablet tab strip during startup. The placeholders will be replaced by real tabs once they are restored, preventing a visual flicker/scroll jank as the restored tabs are rapidly populated to the strip. The number of placeholders and positioning of the active tab is calculated based on tab metadata saved to disk, and thus does not account for tabs created by other means during startup (e.g. user interaction). This histogram records the amount of time for which the placeholders are ready to be shown before the tab state is initialized. This will roughly measure the amount of time that we could have been seeing the flicker/scroll jank without this feature. This is captured when all tabs are finished restoring.

histogram.name: Android.TabStrip.TabGroupCollapsed
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user clicks on the tab group title indicator to collapse or expand it. True if the user is collapsing a group and false if a user is expanding it. We don't record when the collapsed state changes automatically. e.g. Selecting a tab automatically expands its group and groups created through sync are automatically collapsed.

histogram.name: Android.TabStrip.TempBackgroundTimedOut
histogram.summary: Recorded on startup, after a set amount of time. True if we timed out while waiting for the tab strip to be drawn before removing the temp background. False if the tab strip was successfully drawn and we removed the temp background before timing out.

histogram.name: Android.TabStrip.TimeToSwitchTab
histogram.summary: This captures the time taken for a user to select a tab after scrolling the tab strip as one measure of tab strip switching efficiency. This is recorded only when a tab switch event occurs within 60 seconds of the most recent tab strip scroll. In the event of multiple back-to-back scrolls, this metric is recorded so long as the sequence of scrolls occur within 60 seconds of each other and is capped at 3 minutes.

histogram.name: Android.TabStrip.TitleBitmapFactory.getTitleBitmap.Duration
histogram.summary: The duration of TitleBitmapFactory.getTitleBitmap, recorded once per call.

histogram.name: Android.TabStrip.TitleBitmapFactory.getTitleBitmap.Length
histogram.summary:
The full (untruncated) length of the title to be converted to a bitmap by TitleBitmapFactory.getTitleBitmap.
Recorded once per call, if the title is neither null nor empty.

histogram.name: Android.TabSwitcher.CreationTime
histogram.summary: Records the time taken to create the StartSurfaceCoordinator and grid tab switcher views. Only recorded for tablets.

histogram.name: Android.TabSwitcher.IncognitoClickedIsEmpty
histogram.summary: Emitted every time a user uses Incognito button on Tab Switcher. Records whether or not there is any Incognito tab when Incognito button is clicked.

histogram.name: Android.TabSwitcher.SetupRecyclerView.Time
histogram.summary: Records the time taken to create TabListCoordinator, which inflates the RecyclerView for the grid tab switcher, and bind views.

histogram.name: Android.ThumbnailCache.InMemoryCacheEntries
histogram.summary: Records the number of entries for the in-memory ETC1 and bitmap thumbnail cache. Recorded on a Poisson distributed frequency with a mean of 5 minutes starting 1 minute after TabContentManager native initialization.

histogram.name: Android.ThumbnailCache.InMemoryCacheSize
histogram.summary: Records the in-memory ETC1 and bitmap thumbnail cache size in KiB. Recorded on a Poisson distributed frequency with a mean of 5 minutes starting 1 minute after TabContentManager native initialization. Note that this memory may be distributed across the GPU process and Browser process.

histogram.name: Android.ThumbnailProvider.BitmapCache.Size.{ThumbnailProvider_ClientType}
histogram.summary: Measures the size of the bitmap cache used. Recorded whenever a bitmap is added to the cache. {ThumbnailProvider_ClientType}

histogram.name: Android.ThumbnailProvider.CachedBitmap.Found.{ThumbnailProvider_ClientType}
histogram.summary: Records the status of a thumbnail query from the thumbnail provider in-memory cache. {ThumbnailProvider_ClientType}

histogram.name: Android.Toolbar.BitmapCapture
histogram.summary: Recorded when a toolbar view draws itself to a bitmap such that it can be passed to the compositor and drawn by native. Performing a bitmap capture is somewhat expensive opperation that must be done on the UI thread. It is possible that high capture counts are correlated with scroll jank.

histogram.name: Android.Toolbar.StaleCapturedUrlOnScroll.Subsampled
histogram.summary:
Whether or not we have a capture with an out of date url when starting a scroll. This means that we're showing an older url that's different from the url of the current page. This histogram is recorded every time onContentViewScrollingStateChanged(true) gets called with browser controls unlocked.
Subsampled to 1% of the time.

histogram.name: Android.ToolbarPosition.PositionAtStartup
histogram.summary:
Records the user-preferred position for the toolbar at the time ToolbarPositionController is initialized. Initialization occurs once per eligible ChromeTabbedActivity after initial layout inflation completes. A ChromeTabbedActivity is eligible if it is non-CCT, the device is not a tablet, and the bottom toolbar flag is enabled.
The value of the pref defaults to TOP until the user deliberately changes it.

histogram.name: Android.ToolbarPosition.PositionPrefChanged
histogram.summary: Records user-initiated positions change for the toolbar, indicating the newly preferred position. Recorded when the value of the toolbar position preference changes, either via long press or toggling it in the settings page.

histogram.name: Android.TopToolbar.AllowCaptureReason
histogram.summary: Recorded on #isDirty calls that return true. Because #isDirty() is used to control when bitmap captures happen, this histogram holds the reason that the capture was allowed. Note that there there's an assert that calls into #isDirty() from #getBitmap(), which can cause these to be double counted. If Canary starts running assert code, this will cause this metric to double in report volume. Was expired from 2024-01 to 2024-10.

histogram.name: Android.TopToolbar.BlockCaptureReason
histogram.summary: Recorded on #isDirty calls that return false. Because #isDirty() is used to control when bitmap captures happen, this histogram holds the reason that the capture was not allowed.

histogram.name: Android.TopToolbar.CaptureBlocked.OptionalButtonAnimationDuration
histogram.summary: Records how long the optional button was animating for when it causes a capture to be blocked. Only recorded when the duration is longer than 10s.

histogram.name: Android.TopToolbar.CaptureBlocked.StatusIconAnimationDuration
histogram.summary: Records how long the status icon was animating for when it causes a capture to be blocked. Only recorded when the duration is longer than 10s.

histogram.name: Android.TopToolbar.InMotionStage
histogram.summary: Captures the stages reached in the Toolbar's in motion handling. Recorded every time the in motion state of the compositor changes, before the event is routed to the renderer process. Motion states include: flinging, swiping, and any gesture that the CompositorViewHolder is processing. This metric shows how often the in motion handling had to request the toolbar's capture readiness state, which is a computationally expensive operation, and could slow down input handling. Was expired from 2024-01 to 2024-10.

histogram.name: Android.TopToolbar.SnapshotDifference
histogram.summary: When the allow reason for a bitmap capture was that the snapshots were different, then this histogram is recorded with the reason that the snapshots were different. Often there may be multiple differences but one is arbitrarily and consistently picked. Was expired from 2024-01 to 2024-10.

histogram.name: Android.UIDialogShown
histogram.summary: Logs when an Android dialog is shown from either Chrome or WebView. Logs the specific type of dialog which is being shown to the user.

histogram.name: Android.Unfold.Latency
histogram.summary: Records the time taken by chrome to display the first frame presented after unfolding(folding) a foldable device. This histogram aims to capture the unfold latency in devices which switch to tablet mode(phone mode) when unfolded(folded), and is recorded every time the device is unfolded(folded). The begin timestamp of the metric is the timestamp from the start of the first OnPause activity lifecycle callback before the activity recreates. The end timestamp is the timestamp when Chrome displays the first frame on the new screen.

histogram.name: Android.UnfoldToTablet.Latency
histogram.summary: Records the time taken by chrome to display the first frame presented after unfolding a foldable device. This histogram aims to capture the unfold latency in devices which switch to tablet mode when unfolded, and is recorded every time the device is unfolded. The begin timestamp of the metric is the timestamp from the start of the first OnPause activity lifecycle callback before the activity recreates. The end timestamp is the timestamp when Chrome displays the first frame on the new screen.

histogram.name: Android.UnfoldToTablet.Latency2
histogram.summary: Records the time taken by chrome to display the first frame presented after unfolding a foldable device when Chrome is on top. This histogram aims to capture the unfold latency in devices which switch to tablet mode when unfolded, and is recorded every time the device is unfolded. The begin timestamp of the metric is the timestamp from the start of the first OnPause activity lifecycle callback before the activity recreates. The end timestamp is the timestamp when Chrome displays the first frame on the new screen.

histogram.name: Android.VersionCode
histogram.summary:
Version code identifies which bundle is used. It's effectively a version from the Play Store point of view. There can be multiple version codes for a given Chrome version. See go/chrome-android-version-codes.
This is recorded every time a metrics log is created.

histogram.name: Android.View.onDraw.30Seconds
histogram.summary:
Keeps a counter of each onDraw invoked on the root view and emits the count once every 30 seconds. Thus this is the amount of times android attempted to draw/update a java view in the last 30 seconds.
NOTE: 30 second intervals with 0 draws are not reported.
